characters: THE GREEN WASH OF NIGHT VISION GOGGLES
THE BLACK DEAD ZONE SHIMMERING NEARBY
STAVROU LOOKS OUT TO THE STREET
AT THE FRONT OF THE STORE
MORE CRUISE MISSILES APPEAR, RIPPING TOWARD THE GROUND...
AT THE REAR OF THE STORE
A CRUISE MISSILE COMING STRAIGHT DOWN THE STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM SPACE, a view of the EARTH. The vibrant BLUE of its OCEANS is striking against the vast BLACK VOID of space. MOVE CLOSER TO THE EARTH, where the shimmering PACIFIC OC meets the CALIFORNIA COASTLINE... A bird's-eye view of LOS ANGELES comes into relief-- a cr cross of streets, freeways. The buildings not more than d Keep MOVING CLOSER as SOUND FADES IN. We notice MOVEMENT through the sprawl of city now: MASSES PEOPLE and CARS moving AWAY FROM THE OCEAN as we arrive a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND is at a frantic pitch here-- The sound of CHAOS the streets. People SCREAMING, CAR HORNS BLARING as CARS jockey for position, moving eastward among... HORDES OF PEOPLE on foot, their PANICKED FACES rushing pa SUPER: LOS ANGELES-- CONTACT + 1 HOUR as we...

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Then SUPER: THE DAY BEFORE... We are CLOSE ON: SERGEANT MICHAEL NANTZ late 30s, tall, battle-hardened, staring forward, listening impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Must be some kind of mistake... Company 1st SERGEANT JOHN ROY, also late 30s, sits behind desk, holding Nantz' file. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: I got paperwork here, with your signature, says you're retiring.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: No mistake, John.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: My ass. You got a box full a', medals, file full a' commendations.
1ST SGT. ROY (cont'd) Hell, everything but the Good Conduct.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: They can take the Good Conduct Medal and shove it up their...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's what I'm talking about, Mike. You're a marine! Nantzsmiles back now.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I appreciate it, John. You know that. But, I been to too many funerals. Had to visit too many moms and dads, tell 'em about what happened to their sons... BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: Look. You're on that training assignment right now. Why don't you just ride it out for a month or two. See how you feel...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I did my twenty. I'm done. Roy takes this in, nods. He stands, holds his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: You're gonna miss it. Nantz shakes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN WASH OF NIGHT VISION GOGGLES
dialogues.text: Looking out onto ROLLING HILLS and TREES... We hear (O.S.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I don't see it...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the 1st Platoon, 2nd battalion, 5th Marines (the 2/5 Camo uniforms, NIGHT VISION GOGGLES on, stare into the DA CPL. CORREGGIO, 20, linebacker-big, shakes his head, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Screw it. I'm gonna launch another one... The other marines back away quickly as... WIDEN to see we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correggio, GOLF CLUB in hand, steps to a golf tee. WHACK. He tees off. The marines follow the ball as it sails into the darkness

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO -
dialogues.text: That's more like it. PVT. LENIHAN, 18, baby-faced, looks impressed.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Sweet. PVT. IMLAY, 19, a dense but good-natured country boy, mov to the tee.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Don't encourage him. Correggio's freakin' ego's big enough already. He takes the club from Correggio.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Let an expert show you how it's done, bro. Imlay TEES OFF, his swing plainly choppy, uncoordinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he WHACKS THE BALL, visible in the night vision's gree glow. It HOOKS into a sand trap.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mother fu...
Then he stops as a LIGHT flashes beyond the trees.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Foot mobiles. 3 O'clock.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Told you they'd come! THREE GIRLS, 19-21, signal with a FLASHLIGHT. Then race d a small hill onto the golf course.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: The THREE GIRLS sit around a beat-up TAHOE parked near th tee, CASE OF BEER on its back gate, sipping beers. Corpsman ADUKWU, 20, a tall, thin Nigerian, TEES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: That dog'll hunt! Damn, Daktari, you can play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have courses in Nigeria, Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Well, how would I know? I mean, it's an American game.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Actually, Imlay, it's Scottish. PVT. KERNS, 19, an antsy fireplug of a guy, shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Lenihan, you as good with an M-16 as you are with your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Kerns. Lay off him.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: What? Just wanna make sure the rookie won't fold under fire. Correggio shoves a beer into Kerns' hand.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Relax, dude. He throws an arm around Kerns' shoulder, smiles at the gi

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: My buddy's jumpy 'cause he got an assfull a' shrapnel our last tour.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: I'm jumpy? You're crawling up your own ass 'cause we train with Sgt. Nantz tomorrow. Correggio eyes Kerns. This was the wrong thing to say. One girl, smiling seductively, steps to Correggio, takes golf club.from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is the officer's course, what happens if they catch you out here? She readies to take a shot. Correggio snuggles up behind her, ostensibly teaching her how to swing.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: We can handle it, baby. We're experts at night maneuvers. Nearby, the SECOND GIRL chats up Adukwu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're from where again? Imlay pops a beer, interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Nigeria. Adukwu's our corpsman. Like a medic. Saved Kerns' ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daktari, tell her about Nigeria. Adukwu starts to talk, but Imlay interrupts again:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Adukwu's a green card marine... (motions to Lenihan) And Lenihan here-- He's just green. Mom signed so he could join at 17. I'm looking after him since he don't know his ass from a hot rock. Lenihan suddenly ducks behind the Tahoe, throwing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing a good job.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Yeah. We always take the new meat out here to christen 'em... Lenihan shuffles back out from behind the Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Hey, barfy. Grab your beer. toast. Everyone holds beers aloft. Lenihan joins in reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: To Lenihan. Who gets his first taste a' those hills tomorrow. He points off to the HILLY, DESOLATE TERRAIN near the cou

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Good luck, rookie. The marines chuckle knowingly, about to drink... Then they hear the sound of TIRES skidding to a halt. The look toward the hillside, see the WHITE HELMETS'of MPs.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: MPs! The marines grab the goggles and clubs, pile...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE TAHOE
dialogues.text: With the girls. The Tahoe skids away, the beer CRASHING o the back. The first girl eyes Correggio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Experts, huh? Correggio grins sheepishly. She smiles. sweetly, taking h hand, writing her PHONE NUMBER on the back of it as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest working-class two bedroom apartment. A TELEVISIO on in the b.g.. A NEWS PROGRAM:

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: .what appears to be an unprecedented meteor shower, falling off the Falkland Islands.

LT. BENNIE MARTINEZ, 25, whose youthful looks and open sm contrast with his muscular frame, rolls in bed to see... His wife, ANNA, 24, sitting on the edge of the bed next t him, turning something over in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing up so early? She holds up the object in her hands-- It's Martinez' LIEUTENANT BARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. I still have to get used to that. She kisses him lightly, stands. Martinez smiles, watching her move off.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, lot of things we gotta get used to. We see her VERY PREGNANT BELLY now as she smiles back, ex As she does, Martinez turns back to the TELEVISION: 'METEORS' falling into a distant ocean.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This dazzling display is visible from Argentina to Southern Chile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martinez, in uniform now, exits the ground-floor apartmen heads to HIS CAR as Anna exits, watching him go, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later. He stops, smiling back at her now. She waves coyly. Then Martinez is RUNNING BACK TO THE APARTMENT. Moving with the grace of the college football player he w just a few years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't go with him. Just observe from a distanceas... Martinez arrives at Anna, who laughs as he leans down, kissing her stomach now.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAINING COURSE
dialogues.text: The 1st PLATOON of the 2/5, 39 marines, all 18-23 years o sweating as they RUN HILLS in FULL GEAR in the blazing su Key on the MARINES FROM THE GOLF COURSE, staring forward at... Nantz, running up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Heard Nantz put in his papers. He's out.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Good. Wish he done it years ago. Lenihan, struggling, breathing hard, looks up at this, STUMBLING as he does. Nantz, looking back at the chatter, sees... Imlay grab hold of Lenihan, helping him forward now.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Imlay, you gonna wipe his ass for him, too? Every man carries his weight! Nantz drops back, runs alongside the struggling Lenihan.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Just quit, Lenihan. Do us all a favor. 'Cause the squad's only as strong as the weakest man.,.. Lenihan STUMBLES and FALLS IN THE DIRT.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: And right now you're getting us all killed. You hear? On these words, NANTZ MEETS EYES WITH CORREGGIO, further in the pack. Nantz looks away, sees... Imlay, suddenly at Lenihan's side, helping him up. Nantz shoves Imlay away, knocking him onto his ass.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You think you're helping him, Imlay!? You think you're making him stronger?! Nantz puts a boot into Imlay's chest, shoving him flat. Correggio stares at this, steaming.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stay on the goddamn ground, Imlay! You've just been gut-shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your buddy's down, bleeding to death, Lenihan. LZ's at the top of this hill. You gonna let this man die in the dirt on some stinking hill? Or are you marine enough to save him?! Lenihan stumbles to his feet, wiping dirt from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna save him, sir! Lenihan bends, strains, somehow heaves Imlay up. He begins STUMBLING UP THE HILL, carrying Imlay on his ba

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Come on, goddamnit! It's a hot LZ! The chopper's gotta move! They're gonna leave you BOTH to die!!! Lenihan staggers, knees trembling, weaving back and forth Then his foot comes down on a ROCK IN THE TRAIL. His ANKL GIVES WAY. Lenihan falls, yells in pain, grabbing his ank

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Don't you ever tell me you can't! Correggio takes a step towards Nantz now. Kerns stops him

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: He's injured, Sergeant.
A moment as they stare at each other. Nantz, voice like i

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: He's not injured. He twisted his goddamn ankle. Nantz' looks over the men, sweaty, covered with grime.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We are marines. "Can't" is not the code we live by. "Can't" gets marines killed. Do things the right way, the marine way, maybe you get to come home... Maybe your buddy gets to come home. Correggio stares back sullenly on this.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Dying's easy, ladies. Everything else takes balls. Nantz spits on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Adukwu. Run a bag of saline into Lenihan and tape that ankle. We start back in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLOWER SHOP DAY
dialogues.text: We recognize two marines from 1st platoon: CPL. DEVREY HARRIS, 22, African-American, steely, quick-witted, and C NICK STAVROU, 23, a Greek hulk with an easy smile. Harris stares at a TELEVISION on a table behind the count

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .meteors are falling off the coasts of California, Ireland, India, in the Bay of Bengal-- all less than ten miles from land...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Man, I thought Lenihan was gonna wash out today.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Hey, I remember carrying your fat ass up that hill hung over as shit. Newbie gets no sympathy from me.
A woman, CHERISE, 22, Harris' fiancee, hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For three hundred more, she said we could have sprays of lilies. I know it's a lot, but it'd be so beautiful. What d'you think, baby? Harris looks pained. But before he can speak up:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Well, I think it's a no-brainer. You're only getting married once! What, are you gonna worry about three hundred bucks? Cherise looks expectantly to Harris, who smiles back weak

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Of course, baby. Whatever you want She kisses him, heads to the florist as Harris turns on

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Dude, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Busting your balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we shop for cake. Stavrou throws an arm round Harris' shoulder, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: I love cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drab, nondescript office. Kerns sits across a desk from the BASE PSYCHIATRIST, who's consulting a FILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still not sleeping... And the nightmares?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: No. I mean, sometimes. But it's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not drinking, right, private? That's just a crutch...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Alcohol? No, sir. Definitely not. The psychiatrist stares at this. Then WRITES in the file.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: So... What's my status? Am I cleared for combat? I feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's meet again next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two surfers-- CPL. GRAYSTON, 23, looking grizzled beyond years, and PVT. SIMMONS, a spaced-out surfer vibe, sit on boards in the water, staring at... TWO MPs, on the beach, waving them in.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: I don't know why they always have to give us shit. It's not fair.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. GRAYSTON
dialogues.text: Question is, why does everybody think life's supposed to be fair? Why do bad guys want to kill us? Why can't I have a nipple ring? Why is it the more power we get, the more we want? Nothing's fair, Simmons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, Corporal. I just like to blow shit up. Suddenly, a SIREN begins WAILING from the base. Grayston Simmons exchange a glance. They start paddling in quickly

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAINING COURSE
dialogues.text: Nantz is running with another platoon of MARINES. Everyon slows as the SIRENS WAIL from the base.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Hold. The squad stops, following Nantz' gaze to... An approaching dust cloud, being kicked up by... A HUMVEE and TWO FIVE-TON TRUCKS Speeding up the dirt road toward the marines. Everyone is silent as they watch the HUMVEE and TRUCKS pu up... This is not normal. 1st Sergeant Roy hops from the Humvee, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: Marines! Into the trucks. Now. Proceed to the armory and draw weapons. The marines exchange glances, heading for the five-tons. Roy motions to Nantz, who follows him to the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What's going on, John?

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: Look, Mike, I know you're burnt out, ready to move on... Whatever you want to call it. But everybody's being deployed right now. And the platoon's down a sergeant. We need you.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: For what? Do I have a choice here? They arrive at the Humvee. Roy turns to Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: No. You don't. It's all hands on deck, Mike. Nantz nods, resigned. Starts climbing into the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Just don't lose my paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy drives back to base, Nantz next to him. SIRENS are wailing, HELICOPTERS TAKING OFF in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT.. ROY
dialogues.text: Meteor storm's hittin' up and down California now... All I know is, this is a helluva lot more than just some space rocks fallin' out to sea...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What d'you mean? He turns., stares at Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: Whole base is being mobilized. There's some kinda' bad shit hittin' the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee and five-tons swing into the base past a mass activity: TRUCKS being loaded with supplies, TANKS drivin onto flat cars, MARINES racing about.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: You're assigned to 1st platoon, under Lt. Bennie Martinez. His platoon sergeant was rushing back to base, got in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What are the odds? As the Humvee pulls to the COMMAND BUILDING, Nantz sees.. LT. MARTINEZ hurrying to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SGT. ROY
dialogues.text: There's the lieutenant. Young, been with us three months, straight outta basics school. Bright kid, but this is his first deployment, so keep an eye on him, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan and Imlay, Correggio and Kerns are getting their together, hurriedly packing. Lenihan checks and double checks a LIST with the contents his pack, ticking off 'poncho liner,' 'gore-tex jacket,' 'socks,' 'vest,' 'first aid kit,' flashlight'...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: It's probably just a drill, right?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: They shifted Nantz into our unit. Something must be going on.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: I heard Nantz kicked ass on his last tour. Went into a compound by himself, killed, like, ten insurgents...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: That what you heard? You don't know shit, Lenihan. Correggio, pissed, grabs his pack, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Move your asses. They want us in the armory. And he's gone. Lenihan, confused, looks at Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Nantz lost a lotta guys on that tour. Correggio's brother was one of 'em. Lenihan nods, somber, getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez walk through quickly. All around them, NUMEROUS OFFICERS hurry, all responding to RINGING BEEPER Nantz peers into VARIOUS OFFICES. Every one is buzzing wi activity: Clerks bustling, maps spread out, phones ringin
And every office has a TELEVISION on. We hear OVERLAPPING REPORTER'S VOICES from the offices they pass:

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTERS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .cluster of what appears to be meteors is tightly packed... hard for scientists to predict the size or quantity striking the oceans...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: They calling us.in because of these meteors, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: I assume so... Maybe an evacuation. Whatever it is, it'll be good to get out in the field with the men. Nantz looks askance at this. Martinez catches it.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Look, Sergeant, let's be clear. I know your rep, know what you've done... But this is my unit. We're not gonna have a problem, are we?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: No problem, sir. It's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At numerous windows,. LINES OF MARINES hand in weapons ca receiving their weapons in return. Among them... The marines from 1st Platoon of the 2/5 (Correggio and Ke Stavrou and Harris, Imlay and Lenihan, Adukwu), all watch MOUNTED TELEVISIONS-- A WOMAN REPORTER, 20s, on a BEACH. Behind her, POLICE disperse thin CROWDS of PEOPLE, bullho blaring. A legend on the TV screen reads 'SANTA MONICA, C PVT. MOTTOLA, squad radio man, tall and thin, listening t IPOD, and PVT. GUERRERO, lumbering, eyes on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: We never got a chance to finish the new mix, man. We were gonna add some metal to it...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. GUERRERO
dialogues.text: We'll have time later.
The marines stare at the harried reporter on TV.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: .National Guard troops have flown in to evacuate all surrounding beach areas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez crowd in among other SERGEANTS and LIEUTENANTS, the COMPANY CAPTAIN briefing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These objects were completely undetected until they entered our atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: So... what are they, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no idea. But whatever they are, they're not hitting the water at terminal velocity. They're able to slow down before impact. Glances exchanged in the room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no meteor shower. Homeland Security has bumped the threat level to red. Marines, we are the first line of defense. All units gear up, be ready to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young marines from 1st platoon are still in line for their weapons along with many OTHER MARINES. Some are nervously bullshitting, others intently watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTER on the beach looks harried now as THICK SMOK rolls in across the water. POLICE SIRENS wail in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: .some sort of smoke has appeared over the ocean now...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Hey, shut up. Shut up! Others quiet down now. All focus slowly shifting to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter on the beach is cupping her earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I'm being told a Coast Guard cutter just issued a Mayday... The TV SHOT PANS to the WATER... The DISTANT CUTTER lists to one side, SINKING below the w as indistinct DARK SHAPES clamber onto it from the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push forward, scrambling to the TVs.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: What the hell are those things?!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: The CUTTER DISAPPEARS behind the thick rolling SMOKE. The camera PANS back to the REPORTER, silently staring ou

dialogues.speaker: 2/5 PARADE DECK / CAMP PENDLETON
dialogues.text: Crowded with MARINES, including squad leader Grayston, al getting ready. Or they were... Right now, ACTIVITY HAS CEASED. Marines silently stare at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTER ON THE BEACH staring out, clearly panicked.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: It appears... the cutter has... She stops, seeing the SMOKE reach the WATER'S EDGE. A HUS falls over the CROWD as SMOKE rolls across the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formerly bustling... Now all OFFICERS and MARINES are fro crowding around open office doors, staring at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the REPORTER reacts to isolated SHOUTS echoing from th crowd on the beach. Some are pointing out to the ocean...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: What is that...? In the water... The news cameraman PANS to the WATER as it begins to CHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez stand among the other sergeants and lieutenants staring, stunned, at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMS and panicked voices ring out from those ON THE BE now as INDISTINCT FIGURES appear from under the waves. PEOPLE RACE AWAY, plodding along the sand in hopeless fli as these FIGURES charge into the crowd... GUNSHOTS ring out, police shooting at the INDISTINCT FIGU that appear, then disappear in the EVER-THICKENING SMOKE. MOVE IN ON NANTZ, staring at the TV as... The news cameraman RUNS away now, the PICTURE being transmitted growing shaky, indistinct, frenzied as... A DARK FIGURE appears, overruns the cameraman as... The NEWS CAMERA suddenly cuts to BLACK. In black, all we hear is SCREAMS echoing from the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All activity has doubled, a frantic energy now. TRUCKS ra along the perimeter of the air field, massive CH-46 HELICOPTERS TAKE OFF loaded with MARINE UNITS... The 1st platoon stands together, Lt. Martinez addressing as ANOTHER CH-46 HELICOPTER is landing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: As you probably heard, Sgt. Nantz will be taking over for Sgt. Beck. We're lucky to have him aboard. The CH-46 helicopters TOUCHES DOWN now, its massive,, bay opening for them. Martinez barks:

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Let's move, men!, The platoon grabs gear, runs for the helicopter, climbing aboard. Nantz hurries them along, grabbing packs, throwin them on after the marines. Then he grabs Correggio's pack, about to throw the pack o Correggio grabs it back from Nantz. Nantz turns, faces off with Correggio.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You got something to get off your chest, Corporal?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: No. It's cool, Sergeant. You got a Silver Star and my brother came home in a box. I get it. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Get aboard, Corporal. Correggio jumps into the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN FLIGHT. The marines, helmets on, packs between their knees, sit facing each other. The sound of the CH-46's massive rotors is deafening. Som shout over the din, too nervous to remain quiet.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. GUERRERO
dialogues.text: What the hell you think those things are?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Gotta be extraterrestrial.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: You mean, like, from space?!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: No, Imlay. From Canada. Correggio looks down at his hand... Sees the GIRL'S PHONE NUMBER written on it. ACROSS THE DECK, Martinez huddles with Nantz, MAP in hand

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Santa Monica airport's our Forward Operating Base. We get some Cobras and F-18s in the air, we'll have plenty of support. Nantz nods. They're flying into the unknown and Martinez seems as nervous as the younger men. Kerns leans in to Nantz, desperately needing reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: How many a' them you think there are, Sergeant? Nantz just stares out, stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We'll know soon enough, private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines are glued to the windows, shocked by what the seeing as the chopper BANKS toward Venice/Santa Monica: FIRES raging from various explosions. In the distance, MASSIVE LINES of TRAFFIC moving away from the ocean. The STREETS bordering the beach look deserted-- Except fo the BODIES dotting the landscape. Nantz looks at Martinez, who is hunched over, scribbling LETTER. Martinez folds it, then writes the name ANNA on i We realize it's a letter in the event of his death. Martinez stares at the letter. Then carefully tucks it aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport is being quickly transformed into a military base: MILITARY VEHICLES line the runway, more being drive from a nearby CARGO PLANE. The CH-46 LANDS. The platoon JUMPS OUT, squad leaders forming the men up a Nantz and Martinez salute a CAPTAIN heading to them as F- JETS take off, screaming overhead.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Lt. Martinez, sir. 1st Platoon of the 2/5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Situation is as follows: Most of Santa Monica is cleared of civilians. We've got a defensive line at Lincoln Boulevard a mile from the ocean... He points out LINCOLN BOULEVARD on a MAP, the OCEAN close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 9 p.m., everything from Lincoln to the ocean will be bombed. Martinez blanches.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: We're... leveling it, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got an infestation of god- knows-what. It's an enemy ground force only, they have no aircraft. So our jets'll tear 'em a new asshole. We will rule the air.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: But... there must be civilians stuck behind the line, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's affirm. We're getting distress calls, sending squads out. He points to the MAP, to streets running from Lincoln Blv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mission, Lieutenant, take your 1st squad, proceed west from Lincoln to a community center located here... (pointing to map) In a park on 10th and Bay Street. Police were using it as an evacuation point. They got overrun. Get there, any civilians you find, get 'em back here to the FOB for evacuation. You got three hours. Another CHOPPER is LANDING. Nantz yells over the sound:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What do we know about these things, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much. But police have shot 'em. They bleed. The captain, hurrying to the next chopper, yells back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our job to kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez are double-timing with the 1st squad ( Grayston, Correggio and Kerns, Stavrou and Harris, Imlay Lenihan, Mottola and Guerrero, Simmons and Adukwu). As they approach Lincoln, they slow, eyes widening. REVERSE to see what they're staring at: LINCOLN BOULEVARD. Being fortified into a defensive line. MARINES are setting up sand-bagged MACHINE GUN NESTS in a parking lot fronting a nail shop and a China Express. Other MARINES hunker behind barricades in front of a Good Tire Store, firing MORTARS toward the ocean. RUBBLE. BURNING BUILDINGS. Smashed-in storefronts. Cars CRASHED at intersections, the echoing WAIL of CAR ALARMS. Pockets of CIVILIANS are being waved forward by MARINES. LITTLE GIRL with a Smurf backpack is rushed across Lincol
Martinez turns, rallies the squad, most of whom look shoc

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Let's go, marines! Clock's running. Focus on the mission. We're gonna get to that community center and get those people safe. A COBRA ATTACK HELICOPTER screams overhead, firing into t distance. Martinez turns to Nantz, shouting over the din:

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Something to add, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (to the squad) Kill anything that's not human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez lead the squad FROM LINCOLN onto 10th Various STRUCTURE FIRES are visible in the distance. The squad passes a FIRE TRUCK crashed against a fence, en idling. FIREMEN lie near their hose lines, dead. Suddenly... BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Deep, deafening sounds exploding in the distance. The ground SHAKES from massive AFTERSHOCKS. Billowing SMO rumbles from the west. Ash rains,down, the sky turns blac The squad hunkers down, panicked looks exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Keep it together. Watch your angles. The aftershocks fade. Ominous quiet again. The squad continues DOWN THE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Helluva way to get citizenship, eh, Daktari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I'd rather be in Afghanistan.

THICK SMOKE hangs in the air. The lack of visibility is clearly adding to the marines' fright. Numerous SHAPES become visible in the smoke. As the squad approaches slowly, the shapes become clear.. BODIES splayed in the street.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Cherise and I were supposed to register at Bed, Bath & Beyond tonight...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Think you're gonna be busy, bro. Nantz points his rifle into a CRASHED PICKUP TRUCK. A BOD is slumped beneath the wheel. Simmons comes up behind Nantz. Peers into the truck: Sections of the BODY appear almost dissolved by a white phosphorous-like substance.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: What is that shit, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (caustic, dismissive) Something bad, private. Now get back with your team.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa... Contact! Twelve o'clock! A SHAPE is moving to them through the smoke. The marines aim, about to fire just as the smoke clears.. A DOG. Standing there, staring mournfully at them. Nervous chuckles now. Correggio sidles up to Kerns.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Relax, man. Kerns just shoots him a look. The squad moves on. As they approach a SIDE STREET that intersects 10th... The DOG WHINES. Correggio pets it, trying to comfort it..
But the dog suddenly RACES OFF, disappearing into the smo The marines spin, rifles up, growing unnerved...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: What the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Something spooked that dog... Then Kerns sees the SMOKE SWIRLING DOWN THE SIDE STREET.. As if something is racing through it. Kerns breaks formation, SPRINTS DOWN THE SIDE STREET, FIR

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Contact! Contact! Discipline shatters as the squad follows Kerns... DOWN THE SIDE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Marines! Hold your position! Kerns stops, spinning, looking. for targets, breath ragge eyes panicked. Correggio races up.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: What'd you see?! Suddenly, the INDISTINCT FORM of an ALIEN CREATURE appear through the smoke, moving FAST down the side street. Kerns is ready, FIRING. The others react, FIRING as well. The ALIEN FORM is blasted, DROPPING into the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Hold your fire! Hold your fire! Everyone stops firing. Nantz gets in Kerns' face.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: One enemy runs and you break discipline and chase it?! (to the others) Think, marines. Stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: The sergeant is right. Stay on course. We have a mission...
Suddenly, the SHADOWY ALIEN FORM RISES again, darting off disappearing into the smoke. The squad stares back, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: How many rounds it take?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Enough. Correggio edges to Kerns, who's looking panicky.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: They're real, bro. I kept prayin' they wouldn't be...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Quiet. Nantz, unnerved himself, stares into the smoke...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: What is it, sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: That thing running down the street... That was to draw us in... Slowly, fading in, we hear what Nantz hears now... A RUMBLING SOUND BEHIND THEM. Building. Nantz spins to it

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: They're coming. We took the bait, now they're cutting us off.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: I can't see a goddamn thing! But the SOUND of their ADVANCE tells us there's many.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Light it up! The squad lets loose with a barrage of FIRE as...
TRACER FIRE shoots back at the marines from the smoke. Glimpses of INDISTINCT FIGURES moving fast.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Mottola, get on the radio. See if we can get some air support. Mottola starts working the radio, trying to remain calm a PROJECTILES EXPLODE in BRIGHT FLASHES around the marines.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Contact front! Contact front! Correggio, frustrated, peers through the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: What are we shooting at?!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Command says air power is totally committed. Enemy contact all over the area... Martinez stares back at this ominous news as... The MARINES FIRE back into the THICK SMOKE. But the enemy attack keeps INCREASING in ferocity. One PROJECTILE hits a wall above Lenihan. It EXPLODES, so kind of liquid splashing onto him. Lenihan grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Ahh, shit! It's burning! His HELMET is being eaten away by the liquid. Imlay is immediately at Lenihan's side, pulling the helmet off. Lenihan's skin is blistering, oozing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My face, man...! How's my face?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Ugly as ever, bro. The squad hunkers down, trying to find any cover-availabl behind cars, trees. Martinez drops BEHIND A CAR, pulls out his MAP, checking for escape routes.-
Chaos as ENEMY TRACER FIRE increases, exploding around th Martinez looks desperate, forced to FLEE FROM COVER by th alien fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall back! Here! He leads them further down the side street.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We can hold this position, Lieutenant!

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: We're gonna get pinned down!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Sir, these things seem to be operating tactically! Don't let them dictate your decisions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move to live, marines! The squad follows Martinez, retreating... INTO A 'WALK' STREET. JUST A SIDEWALK separates the houses opposite each other. A moment. SILENCE. Nantz looks at the heavy FOLIAGE, dens SHRUBS and TREES on both sides. He knows:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: It's an ambush. This is the kill zone! Nantz slings his COMBAT SHOTGUN forward.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: On Nantz' order, the SQUAD OPENS FIRE just as... ALIEN FIRE EXPLODES from the THICK COVER of bushes and tr Nantz leads the brutal counterattack, PUMPING and FIRING combat SHOTGUN. Martinez is shouting orders, directing the men as...

Kerns backs against a fence, overwhelmed by the chaos. ; aims, shoots. Then he freezes. Correggio steps in front of Kerns, firing to protect him. Lenihan takes a hit from the enemy tracer fire exploding around the marines. He's blown back into thick bushes as. THE REST OF THE SQUAD battles fiercely. An alien PROJECTILE slams into Cpl. Grayston'S ARM. The SPRAY OF LIQUID bubbles out from the wound. Then something grabs Grayston through the bushes... Nantz sticks his SHOTGUN into the bushes, fires. BOOM. An Grayston is suddenly free. Nantz drags him into... THE FRONT YARD OF A HOUSE. The squad follows, Correggio pulling Kerns into the yard. THEY BACK TOWARD THE HOUSE. Guerrero, Imlay and Simmons lay down an awesome barrage w powerful SAWS (Squad Automatic Weapon), covering.the retr Trees and bushes are shredded, houses are splintered. All this mayhem allows the squad to... BARGE THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR OF THE HOUSE. Pandemonium. The marines are sweaty, bleeding, scared.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Jesus! Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Keep your shit together!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: What the hell are those things?!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: They're the goddamn enemy.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, and there's a million of 'em!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Where'd they come from?! Why'd they come here?!

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Everyone... just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Calm down?! We keep shooting them... Why don't they die?!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stow that shit, Private. (turns, to the others) Watch the yard. Secure the back. We're not dyin' here today. The marines take up firing positions at windows and doors CORREGGIO EYES KERNS.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: You okay? Kerns stares back, deer in the headlights. He nods. ADUKWU IS WRAPPING GRAYSTON'S ARM as Grayston fumbles for CIGARETTE. Adukwu lights it for him.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. GRAYSTON
dialogues.text: I know. These things'll kill me. Adukwu smiles. Grayston stares at his arm, ironically:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. GRAYSTON
dialogues.text: Hell, now that just ain't fair. Nantz moves to Martinez, who is staring down at the wound Grayston and Guerrero.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Sir, what are your orders? Martinez turns, stares at Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: I led us right into that ambush.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Sir. Your orders. Beat. Martinez nods.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Let's figure out how we get out of here. We'll medevac the wounded from that park.
Nantz nods, turns to Mottola.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Radio the FOB. Get us a medevac at that park by the community center. As Mottola works the radio, he's startled to see Guerrero who has been SLASHED across both eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. GUERRERO
dialogues.text: I can't see, Motorola. Mottola, horrified, steadies his voice.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: You'll be okay. A slight beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. GUERRERO
dialogues.text: You're one shitty liar, bro.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Hey, where the hell is Lenihan?! Everyone stops, stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan, pressing a hand into his side, BLOOD oozing betw his fingers, peers INTO THE BACK YARD at... A SWIMMING POOL, its water gently lapping. A GARAGE nearb Lenihan, startled by the SOUND of ALIENS RUNNING in the a behind the house, takes cover BY THE GARAGE. He struggles to remain calm. Then the sound FADES. He waits. Silence. Lenihan starts to edge,out as... A BANG rings out on the far side of the garage. Lenihan spins back behind cover, eyes desperately searchi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz shoulders his M-16. Martinez eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I'll go for Lenihan, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: All right. We'll package the wounded, then rally on 10th street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mottola, Imlay. Go with the sergeant. The two quickly step to Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: We got your six, Sergeant. Anything you need.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What I need is for you to keep quiet. And stay close.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Right. Got it. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Starting now, Private. As Nantz turns, Mottola slaps Imlay in the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan creeps around the garage, spies a SIDE DOOR leadi into it. He grabs the handle. Mercifully, the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan falls INTO THE DARK GARAGE. Boxes and old furnitu Just one dirt-stained WINDOW on an opposite wall. Lenihan crouches in the dim light, coughs, spitting up bl He turns on his radio, says into it:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Motorola? You copy? His RADIO buzzes back with Nantz' voice:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Lenihan. This is Sgt. Nantz...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Sergeant, Jesus, I had to turn the radio off..'. These things are everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz is MOVING, with Mottola and Imlay. covering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming for you, Lenihan. What's your location?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan looks across the garage, out of the window...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: I'm in a garage... I can see two palm trees right next to it. House is white with black shutters... Just as something BANGS against the garage.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Is the house a two-story? Lenihan stares, his eyes going wide, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lenihan, is the house a...? Lenihan CLICKS the radio OFF. Then waits, very still, listening, M-16 held tightly. His breathing turns shallow-- from loss of blood and from fea Lenihan sees the BRANCHES of a bush SWAYING outside the window, as if something just brushed past it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz, Mottola and Imlay moving through the thick smoke.. Nantz still trying to raise Lenihan on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Lenihan...? Lenihan...? Imlay taps Nantz on the shoulder, motions to his ears. He hears something... The marines freeze, Nantz clicking the radio off as... Nearby, they hear SOUNDS of aliens running... Somewhere..
The marines crouch, weapons up, straining to see through smoke. They remain stock still. Then... The sound fades into the distance. Nantz looks at the men. Motions. They creep forward as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenihan moves TO THE WINDOW, searching the garage floor, desperate not to step on anything that would make noise. edges forward to peer through the dirty glass. Then... THUD THUD THUD. More NOISES... On the garage roof now. Lenihan looks up, panicked as... CRASH! The WINDOW suddenly CRASHES IN. Lenihan spins, FIRING wildly, lighting up the garage as.. He stumbles to the door, fumbling for the handle, falling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .OUT OF THE GARAGE. Lenihan staggers back, eyes darting along the garage roof, gun aimed. Nothing there. As Lenihan continues backing away, peering through the drifting smoke at the garage, he's unaware that BEHIND hi A SHADOWY ALIEN FORM IS RISING FROM THE POOL. Lenihan doesn't see it, but he senses it. He turns, FIRES A SPLASH as the shadowy alien figure is blasted back INTO POOL, disappearing under the water. Quickly, nervously, he loads another mag, edging to the p He peers over the pool edge... An indiscernible DARK FORM lays on the bottom of the pool Lenihan is transfixed a moment. Then he raises his rifle punch more rounds into the thing as... WHOOOM! The creature launches OUT OF THE WATER!

BLISTERING GUNFIRE! As Nantz, Mottola and Imlay burst int the yard. They fire, as does Lenihan. The fusillade of bullets tears the creature up. The marines STOP FIRING as the alien falls to the ground. They stare amazed at the 7 ft. tall ALIEN CORPSE... Rigid skeleton bursting out of its skin, some strange layer of machinery intertwined with its flesh.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Oh my God... What the hell are these things?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: They're butt ugly, that's what they are. Nantz grabs onto Lenihan, noticing his wound.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're gonna get you to the medevac, Private.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sergeant. Thanks for coming for me.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: But Lenihan...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Ever get separated from your unit again, I'll find you and shoot you myself.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. LENIHAN
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant. Imlay slings Lenihan's arm around his shoulder and they'r instantly moving, RUNNING FROM THE YARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men meet up with the others. Adukwu and Kerns carryin Grayston on a litter, Simmons holding onto the blinded Guerrero, guiding him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: All right, let's get to the community center... They head off, Simmons still supporting Guerrero as THWAC An alien projectile slams INTO SIMMONS' THROAT. Choking, CRUMPLES to the ground. Guerrero stands, blind, helpless. Panic. The marines spin, searching for targets.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Move! Grab Simmons! Go, go! Stavrou hoists Simmons as the marines run off, FIRING to cover their retreat, as... The SILHOUETTES of DARK ALIEN FORMS are visible on distan rooftops, watching the rifle squad disappear down the str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz, Martinez and the rest of the squad hustle silently through the street, supporting their wounded. They take cover behind cars, peering out to see... The PARK in the distance. A wide open FIELD with a COMMUN CENTER BUILDING on the far side. There are distant sounds of warfare, but the area here se strangely quiet. Then, out of the smoke, an IMAGE APPEARS... Something MOV AT THEM... The marines all shift, aim forward, about to blast away a FOUR MARINES come into view, moving ghost-like. Nantz signals with his flashlight. The marines hurry over silently falling behind the cars.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: You guys are 2/5?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2nd squad, 3rd platoon...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Where's the rest of your unit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, Lieutenant. Everyone else is dead or missing. The news hits Martinez hard. He eyes Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on the street, like, ten minutes and they ambushed us. As soon as we radioed for help, it's like they were everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medevac's incoming, lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: All right. Stay with us. And the squad moves out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large FIELD stretches from the street to a squat BUILDI the COMMUNITY CENTER. The specter of LIGHTS is thrown onto the field, an other worldly effect until we realize the lights are coming fro

dialogues.speaker: A MEDEVAC HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Descending steadily, its thundering rotors whipping the a

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Load the wounded. Sgt. Nantz, Cpl. Harris-- let's find the civilians. Martinez, Nantz and Harris run to the community center as The WOUNDED are hustled to the CHOPPER as it TOUCHES DOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines burst in, looking around. To the right, a GYM To the left, a HALLWAY with numerous side rooms off of it

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: U.S. Marines! U.S. Marines! A clattering. The marines immediately move toward it, peering down the dark hall...
Then the DOOR to a side room OPENS to reveal... A WOMAN, MICHELE, 28, staring out, looking shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: How many of you? A MAN, JOE RINCON, 45, jacket and tie, behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's five of us. Three kids. Nantz is immediately moving.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Where? Where are the kids? He pushes past the adults, sees TWO GIRLS AND A BOY, 8-10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines run up to the chopper with the wounded. INSID THE MEDEVAC they see WOUNDED laid across the helicopter's cabin. A CREWMAN in the medevac yells over the din:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called in with two wounded!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: We got four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't take four! We have no room!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Make goddamn room! A beat. The crewman relents in the face of Stavrou's impressive bulk, tries to make room. Imlay and Stavrou get Simmons and Grayston on. Mottola helps Guerrero in, squeezing his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. GUERRERO
dialogues.text: I'll work on that mix for you.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude. Think I'm gonna need it. Lenihan crawls onto the chopper's deck with Imlay's help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just had to get outta the shit. Lenihan smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! We're moving now! Imlay bumps fists with Lenihan, backs away as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz runs out with the BOY. Followed by Martinez and Harris, hustling the two GIRLS out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Wait! Stavrou, hold it! KIDS! Stavrou tries to hold the chopper, screaming at it as... THE MEDEVAC RISES. Nantz, Martinez and Harris run to the chopper with the ki The marines around the medevac are screaming up at it, tr to hold it, but to no avail. The CHOPPER GAINS ALTITUDE as suddenly... BOOM! A SHOCK WAVE OF ENERGY FIRES from the west as... The MEDEVAC takes a DIRECT HIT. The devastating energy wave blasts it END-OVER-END... The massive helicopter CRASHES INTO A HOUSE blocks away, exploding, as... Nantz turns ominously as an unearthly BUZZING SOUND FADES LIGHTS are ADVANCING from a street leading to the field. As the SOUND and LIGHTS BUILD, Nantz runs to the other marines to get them off that field. He pulls on them, urging them to the COMMUNITY CENTER doo They REACH THE COMMUNITY CENTER, fall into it just as... Glowing through the heavy cover of smoke... The STROBING LIGHTS of some strange ALIEN AIRCRAFT zooming overhead.
Speeding toward Lincoln. FIRING PULSING WAVES OF ENERGY, lighting up the distant sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines and civilians fall into the large entryway. T marines are breathing hard, looking stunned.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Goddamn flying saucers now...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those guys on the chopper...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Why'd those bastards have to come down here and start this shit?!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: That is not relevant, Imlay! They're here. They're trying to kill us. Kill them first! Martinez eyes Nantz on this. Then barks orders:

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Secure the perimeter! Stavrou, give me an ammo check. Cpl. Correggio, take three men, set up an Observation Post on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You heard the lieutenant. Move! The dazed marines begin COVERING doors and hallways. We s in their FACES that it's a very different fight now. Nantz turns, can see the MEDEVAC ABLAZE out a window. His solemn stare hints at a growing desperation. Martinez steps up to him, looks out. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: They got air power, too... Knocked that medevac right out of the sky. So much for ruling the air. Nantz just keeps staring out.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Listen, Sergeant. These men are scared. A little compassion would go a long way... Nantz turns on Martinez now.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: How's that gonna help them survive, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lead these marines. But don't ask me to get close to them. Nantz walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines on post, watching various windows and doors. Imlay kneels by the kids, who look devastated by the day' events. Imlay wets a rag with water from his canteen, wip the dust and dirt from the kids' faces. The younger girl, KIRSTEN, 8, begins crying. She suddenly hugs Imlay. Imlay, startled by this, looks uncomfortable at first. Th hugs the little girl back, smiling at the older.girl, ANY 10, Kirsten's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna leave us, are you? A beat. Then Imlay smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: No way, sweetheart. The woman, Michele McDermott, is clearly rattled, struggl for composure, eyes constantly moving to the kids. Mr. Rincon, a calm, watchful air about him, stands with h son, HECTOR, the kid who Nantz had carried to the chopper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son and I came here... There were only three cops, spread pretty thin... Then those things attacked. Police couldn't stop them.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What happened to everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Most people ran. We hid in a side room, found Michele and the girls... Couldn't see what happened. Just heard... Screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my nieces for the week. My sister and her husband are in Hawaii for their anniversary... Is it safe there? I heard this is happening in other places... Martinez is at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they want from us? Why are they here?

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: I...don't know. Right now, our job is just to get you to safety, okay? Harris appears from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, something you should see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Nantz and Martinez edge out with Harris. they peer into the smoke drifting past the building, an I becomes clear... An ALIEN BODY. On the ground nearby. Ripped by bullets. They step to it cautiously, realizing... IT'S NOT QUITE D The alien MOVES, turning as if to stare back at them. Without a word, Nantz lifts his rifle, shoots it in the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector sits with Kirsten and Amy, digging candy Nerds out his backpack. He turns to the other kids, holding the box out. Both kids reflexively accept handfuls of candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Hector notices Imlay standing nearby. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some Nerds? Imlay holds his hand out. Hector shakes candy into it as. Nantz enters, calling to Adukwu:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Adukwu, bring your kit. Adukwu is immediately up, moving to Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're gonna cut one of these things open. See if we can figure out what makes 'em tick. Michele overhears, offering: MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help, sergeant. I'm a vet...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You're a veteran? MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't help but smile) No, a veterinarian.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Oh... Okay. Well, thanks, um... Nantz has forgotten her name. She smiles. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michele.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Right. Michele. (smiles, embarrassed)) Sorry. Mottola walks up.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Sergeant. Can't raise anybody on the radio. We're cut off. Off Nantz' look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerns, Correggio and TWO 2nd SQUAD MARINES are on watch, peering down to the street from opposite sides of the roo All on edge, exhausted, dirty. No one says a word. Correggio eyes the other marines. They exchange an 'all- clear' sign. Then Correggio pulls up a radio.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: (INTO RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.P. reporting. We're clear up here. Correggio and Kerns look over the destroyed streets, smok and flames rising from buildings in the distance, glimpse white phosphorous raining down. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: .fucking aliens. Kerns looks at Correggio, starts to chuckle at the absurd of it all. Then Correggio laughs. It's infectious. It's desperate. Then the laughter slows. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: You think those things get scared? They're probably just grunts like us. Probably dumped into battle, told to go fight... Kerns looks out... The constant thud and crack of warfare A city crumbling. V

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: I thought I could handle it...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: You are handling it. Thing I'm worried about is Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Sergeant saved our ass at that ambush... He knows what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Yeah? Tell my brother that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz enters with Michele and Adukwu. Stavrou and Harris in the room with Martinez. They step aside, revealing... ALIEN BODY on the floor. Michele stops, stares. She and Adukwu are both taken abac at the sight of one of these things up close.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You sure you can do this? MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was more sure two minutes ago. She looks to Adukwu. They step to the body together as... Nantz approaches Martinez.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What's the plan, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Mission is still to get the civilians to the Forward Operating Base. We've got a battalion there, all that firepower... I was thinking, I saw a bus couple of blocks back on 11th...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Maybe we should stay on foot. Martinez looks at Nantz. Then opens a MAP, pointing to 'Santa Monica Airport' on it.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: The FOB is here, at the airport... That's miles to cover with those kids... And those bombs are gonna drop in a little more than an hour. (thinking, deciding) We've got to move fast.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We have no radio contact, nothing to let us know the best route to take... And a bus is a big target.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: I made the call, Sergeant. It's my responsibility.
Beat. Then Nantz nods, turns.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Harris, Stavrou, lieutenant needs recon on a.bus. It was abandoned two blocks south off 11th...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: If it runs, get it back here.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Can you hotwire a bus?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: (gestures to Stavrou) He's from Jersey, sergeant. A nod from Nantz on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correggio and Kerns are surveying the street. Correggio pulls the RADIO up, talks quietly into it:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Stavrou, Harris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou and Harris peer out an EXTERIOR DOOR as they hear Correggio (V.0.) from the RADIO:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .you're clear down 11th Street. They exchange a quick glance.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Every day a holiday, buddy...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: .every meal a feast. They slip outside, running off silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correggio and Kerns watch Harris and Stavrou run down the street, covering them with their M-16s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adukwu and Michele, scalpels in hand, hover over the alie body. Its thick leathery skin has been sliced open. Martinez and Nantz observe, Imlay on post nearby.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: How's it going? ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Lieutenant, I'm a medic, Dr. McDermott's a vet... We weren't sure who was most qualified to cut this thing open. Martinez smiles. ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. It's been surgically modified... He pulls tissue aside, revealing where the alien's 'gun' attached to its arm. ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of its arm has been amputated to fit this weapon.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Talk about commitment to cause. Adukwu examines a VENTED CAP just to the right of where t alien's 'heart' would be. Thick, fleshy veins run from it

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: What is that thing?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: He's from Nigeria, Lieutenant. Not a different solar system. Nantz looks over at Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Thank you, private. Adukwu twists the cap. It comes free, revealing... A GELATINOUS ORGAN. Slimy, viscous fluid seeping from it. Everyone steps back, reacting to the putrid smell.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Whoa, that stinks! Everyone steps back except Michele, that is. Unfazed, she takes her scalpel, makes an INCISION across the organ.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna puke. Swear to God, I'm gonna puke!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, do it quietly, Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou forces the door of a METRO BUS open, climbs INTO BUS, ducking below the steering wheel as... Harris covers, staring off to the FAR STREET. Tree branch there cast LONG SHADOWS which sway with the breeze. Then. The indistinct FORM of an ALIEN scout appears in the shad

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Stavs...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Relax. First thing I wired was a school bus. Trying to impress this Betty. She had a huge rack...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Enemy scout. Move your ass. Stavrou doesn't look up. Just works diligently.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Don't rush genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correggio and Kerns remain still, peering into the distan

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Shit. You seeing what I'm seeing? Correggio pulls BINOCULARS... POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: A SIDE STREET, TREES overhanging

Movement. ALIEN SHAPES massing on the side street. Appearing and disappearing through the smoke and trees. Then the POV THROUGH BINOCULARS PANS to pick-up... The BUS. Nearby. In the path of the alien movement. Correggio grabs the RADIO. Says:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: (INTO RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris. Movement, 1500 meters up 11th. Suddenly, a loud BANG rings out below them.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?! They exchange glances with the other marines across the r All four move quickly, converging on one side of the building, look down the side of it... An EXTERIOR DOOR leading into the center is BROKEN OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michele finishes her incision, carefully PEELS A SECTION THE ORGAN BACK. Something vaguely METALLIC is revealed within it. As Michele touches her scalpel to it, it SPARKS. Then starts rhythmically GLOWING.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Looks like it's receiving a signal... Suddenly, the ORGAN CONVULSES rapidly. Expanding, contracting. Nantz sees the ALIEN'S GUN VIBRATING now, the whole arm TWITCHING, spreading through the alien's body like a seiz

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: This thing's still alive! Nantz pulls his KA-BAR FIGHTING KNIFE, thrusting it DEEP THE ORGAN, twisting viciously.
The organ stops vibrating. The glow fades. The body slump

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Not so hard to kill when you know where to aim. Mottola appears in the room, a sense of controlled panic.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. There's a breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines step from the side room with Michele. They pe up and down the dark hallway, listening... OTHER DOORS along the hall take on an ominous presence no

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (LOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They in the building?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: No clue, Sergeant. An exterior door was broken open.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Maybe we should gather the civilians in the gym.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Good idea, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou, still beneath the wheel. Harris, eyes on the str as the RADIO crackles with Correggio's VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Harris, hostiles advancing right at you. Approximately two hundred meters and closing...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Done! Stavrou hops into the driver's seat, tries to start the b It doesn't turn over. Harris and Stavrou exchange a quick glance. Stavrou drops below the wheel again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ominous BANGS ring out from down the long hallway, BUILDING in intensity. Nantz stands, staring DOWN THE DARK HALL with his M-16, surprised as Martinez steps up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: We're in it together, Sergeant. Martinez slams a grenade into his launcher now.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mottola. Get that bus here! Mottola is on the radio, frantic:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Where the hell is that bus?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou is still underneath the wheel. Harris looks out t see ALIENS rounding the corner in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Get this thing started.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Hey, why didn't I think a' that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! Down the hall, the sound of a door splintering...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're out of time! Martinez looks INTO THE GYM, sees the kids staring back.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Go! Get 'em out! Imlay swings the GYM DOOR OPEN, moving the civilians out.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez stand together, aiming at the hall as. A final BANG... We hear a door being BURST OPEN.

Nantz, in the front, exchanges a glance with Martinez at ominous sight of... A PLUME OF BLACK SMOKE rising in the distance. THEY SPIN ONTO LINCOLN BOULEVARD. Screech to a halt at the obstacle course of BATTLE WRECKA strewn across the street. Noxious BLACK SMOKE is rising from BURNING HUMVEES and TRUCKS. Smoking CRATERS pothole the street.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Those alien ships took the whole line out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We've got forty minutes 'til they level this area.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: (TO STAVROU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us to the Forward Operating Base. Fast. Stavrou lays on the gas, speeding away as, in the back, t other marines stare out. Mottola peers into the sky...'

dialogues.speaker: PVT. MOTTOLA
dialogues.text: Where the hell are all our jets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus snakes through jammed streets, abandoned cars, bo out buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martinez is in the front with Stavrou, Nantz in the middl the bus, hovering near the civilians sitting on the floor Rincon holds Hector, Michele with her arms around both gi Marines on the seats above, weapons ready. Nantz hears Imlay whispering to Harris:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Why the hell'd the lieutenant wanna take a bus? We're sittin' ducks.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (low, hard) The call's been made, private. You so eager to decide the fate of all these people? Imlay is stone silent.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Didn't think so. Then Nantz looks up, meeting eyes with Martinez as... A NOISE in the distance now. A low VIBRATION, building. Nantz moves to Martinez. They peer out of the front. LIGHTS fill the sky, heading east. As they approach... The VIBRATION gets louder and louder, shaking the bus now

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Everybody get down, weapons inside the bus. Make no noise. The men pull their guns in from the windows, crouching as as possible, straining to see, hear... The vibrations grow louder, LOUDER! Suddenly... WHOOSH! An ALIEN AIRCRAFT rips overhead. Then another, and another, and another... All heading eas The image of their speed, their power, their other- worldliness is overwhelming, devastating. Nantz stares, relief flooding his face, as the armada fli on. Leaving them behind. Until... Suddenly, Mottola's RADIO BLARES! COMMAND (FROM RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stations this net, urgent traffic. Multiple enemy aircraft moving east... As the transmission rings out, Nantz looks up to see... One ALIEN SHIP split from the armada, TURN BACK TO THE BU

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: It's coming back...! The children scream, marines agitated... all hear a low vibration, echoing off buildings, heading their way.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (staring at the radio, REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill that radio! Mottola turns off the radio. The alien aircraft STOPS. Hovers a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: They're tracking our signals! All radios, cell phones-- keep everything off! Everyone stares silently, tensely. Then... A single BEAM OF LIGHT suddenly shines from the alien cra Then the alien aircraft MOVES FORWARD again. Slowly. But still heading their way.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: It's still coming... It's searching... Nantz grabs a PORTABLE RADIO. He looks around the bus, sees the little girl, Kirsten, ponytail in her hair. He leans down to her.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Hi. Could I have your, uh, hair thing? She stares, wide-eyed, at this fearsome, sweating marine. KIRSTEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... pony holder? Nantz nods. She pulls the PONY TAIL HOLDER from her hair, hands it to Nantz. He smiles. Briefly. Heads to the front

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Anything happens, Lieutenant, get the SAWS up front and take off with these kids.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Sergeant... BUT NANTZ IS OUT OF THE BUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz runs down the street with the radio under his arm. Heading toward a GAS STATION. Nantz glances back, sees... The ALIEN AIRCRAFT SEARCHING street below, getting closer and closer to the bus as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Kirsten pressed under seats, Michele covering the up... Hector closing his eyes in his dad's arms... The marines duck low, gripping their weapons. They hear the aircraft coming closer, almost above them. LIGHT starts shining through the windows as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz, almost to the gas station, wraps the pony tail hol around the radio, looks back to see. The ALIEN AIRCRAFT STOP, HOVERING OVER THE BUS! Shining lights into it, scanning, scanning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector's eyes widen, staring up at the light. Michele pul the girls in closer, trying to calm them, herself. MICHELE (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay, it's gonna be okay, it's all gonna be okay. Everyone freezes as the BEAM reflects off the walls, fill the space with a horrible bright light, exposing them as.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz presses the "Push to Talk" button on the radio as.. The alien craft suddenly TURNS in NANTZ' DIRECTION. Nantz wraps the pony tail holder around the radio, keepin the button on it depressed so it's SENDING A CONSTANT SIG He slides the radio toward one of the GAS PUMPS... Keeps moving, diving BEHIND A VAN across the street. Nantz peers around it, sees... The alien aircraft HEADING FOR THE GAS STATION, descendin Nantz slams a grenade into the launcher on his M-16. The alien aircraft zooms at the gas pumps, its unearthly growing louder and louder as... NANTZ FIRES THE GRENADE. The GAS PUMP EXPLODES! A MASSIVE FIREBALL HITS THE ALIEN

dialogues.speaker: CRAFT
dialogues.text: Nantz flattens himself to the street as... The ALIEN AIRCRAFT, trailing smoke and flames, thunders o of control RIGHT OVER HIM... Then CRASHES into a building... BLOWING APART!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines ducking, civilians screaming as... DEBRIS from the alien ship BLOWS OVER THE BUS, burning pi falling to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz runs out from behind the van, checks the remains of burning alien aircraft, rifle raised. NO ALIEN inside. The ship is a DRONE. Nantz takes this in, then starts back for the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz runs back onto the bus as Stavrou pulls swiftly awa

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (TO MARTINEZ)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ship was an unmanned drone, lieutenant. And that alien we cut open had something in it receiving signals... They must have one helluva command and control center. Martinez pulls his map out, eyes Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: That was some real John Wayne shit, Sergeant. Nantz tries to shrug it away. But Martinez nails him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Don't do it again. We work as a team, Sergeant. We clear? Beat. Nantz nods.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're clear, Lieutenant. Nearby, Imlay whispers to Mottola:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Who's John Wayne? Martinez looks up from the map, turns to Stavrou.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
