dialogues.text: Take the freeway, Corporal. Cuts half the distance off our drive.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Sir. We get on that freeway, we'll be exposed...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem like we're much safer out here. We've got two shitty options-- I'm choosing the one that gets us there fastest. (then, quietly) We don't want to be in this area when the bombs start to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus bangs past a few stalled cars, cruising up a ramp onto the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martinez and Nantz crouch near the front, keeping watch. From this elevated vantage point on the freeway, the big picture emerges IN THE DISTANCE: The BATTLE FRONT is moving east... A DEFENSIVE LINE of TA is visible, blasting away at aliens. SWARMS of DRONE AIRCRAFT engage F-18 JETS flying at them.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Jesus... (TO STAVROU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double time, Corporal. The bus barrels forward, careening BETWEEN CARS, knocking some out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Take the next exit. Head south. We're two clicks from the FOB. The bus drives onto the shoulder, past the sea of abandon cars, heading to the off-ramp. Nantz appears uneasy. They are exposed on this freeway an he doesn't like it. He MOVES TO THE BACK, peering out windows, checking angle Michele looks up as he passes, sees a GASH on Nantz' head MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your head, Sergeant. You're bleeding. Nantz touches his head, looks at the blood. He wipes it o his pants. Michele smiles at him softly. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet when you woke up this morning, you didn't think your day would end up like this.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: That's a pretty safe bet.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Hostiles. Back up. Now, go! Stavrou guns the BUS BACKWARDS, knocking abandoned cars o of the way...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Guess you were right, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Incoming! Down! Down! Down! A projectile EXPLODES next to the bus! Sending CARS FLYIN SHRAPNEL TEARS A GIANT HOLE through the side of the bus. TWO 2nd SQUAD MARINES are instantly killed, blown clear o of the hole. Civilians screaming... Stavrou hits the gas, BACKING THE BUS UP the best he can. An ILLUMINATION heading toward them... BOOM! Another projectile DESTROYS AN OVERPASS behind the bus! Trapped. And ALIENS are STREAMING AT THEM in the distance Stavrou works the shift, grinding gears, gunning the bus. BEHIND A CONCRETE DIVIDER close by the COLLAPSED OFF-RAMP The off-ramp now dangles precariously: a 15-foot cliff-fa of missile-scarred concrete and re-bar. Martinez looks over to Nantz, not sure what to do...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (to Martinez, low) Let's dismount, set up a perimeter, get the civilians down to the street.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Stavrou, get down that ramp, secure the street! Kerns, Adukwu, help get the civilians off the freeway. Stavrou starts off the bus for the broken off-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Harris, Imlay, give us overwatch up on the roof. The rest of you push out 20 meters, set up a perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: And don't forget, aim chest, right! Imlay joins Harris, SMASHING THE SKYLIGHT out of the bus roof, CLIMBING OUT, taking position on the bus' roof. The rest of the marines EXIT THE BUS. Nantz grabs Adukwu.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stay here with the civilians. As soon as Stavrou gives the sign, get them down to the street! Adukwu nods. Nantz starts off the bus. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up at Nantz) Are we gonna die? Nantz turns back to Hector. Manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Course not, kid, we're the good guys. And Nantz is off the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imlay and Harris, prone, propped on their elbows, Imlay scanning through binoculars, sees... 30-40 ALIEN FIGHTERS coming their way.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: I got about three dozen hostiles, twelve o'clock. 300 meters now. Coming fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz stands with Martinez at the concrete barrier. Nantz scans the marines' positions.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Prepare to repel. Fix bayonets! This might get up-close and personal! Just a low CLATTERING now, the battle-rattle of Nantz and men fixing BAYONETS to their rifles. Nantz-yells out:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Cpl. Harris!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Being vastly outnumbered provides a marine rifleman with what?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: A target rich environment, sir!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Marines. We stand here. Let these bastards know who they're fucking with.
Sporadic FIRE now, as the marines fire on the advancing aliens, still at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou descends down the collapsed off-ramp, negotiating fractured, angled slab of roadway. Kerns covers him above, from the freeway. Stavrou hits the ground, securing the area. He looks up a Kerns and gives him the "All Clear" sign. Kerns takes off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adukwu stands in.the bus, looking out to see Kerns runnin back to them, signalling. Adukwu turns to the civilians crowded behind him. ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's clear. We're gonna go. Amy and Kirsten, terrified, look up at Michele. She hurri the girls to the door of the bus as Kern runs up. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'll be right behind you. Adukwu picks up Amy. Kerns picks up Kirsten.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: (takes a breath, telling them, himself) It's gonna be scary but we can do it, okay? An alien round flies through the bus, shattering the back window! The girls scream. Kerns and Adukwu race away, running with the girls... Rin grabs Hector. He and Michele follow... RUNNING ACROSS THE FREEWAY... To the off-ramp. It seems like a long way off. They run past Correggio, rocking a SAW full auto. The FIRE is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Come on!! Come on!! Get some! Rincon and Michele, breathing ragged, feet pounding, look up... They're getting closer and closer to the off-ramp a Alien rounds blow chunks of concrete off the roadway... UP AHEAD, Kerns and Adukwu rush the girls to the EDGE OF RAMP, hurrying to get them down as... Rincon and Michele REACH THE OFF-RAMP now. Kerns grabs Hector, HELPING HIM ANGLE DOWN THE OFF-RAMP, getting the boy safely handed down to awaiting Stavrou as

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Rincon spins, sees the marine drop, SCREAMING. Rincon looks back at Adukwu, who is busy getting Michele the off-ramp now. Then Rincon looks back to the freeway, sees Mottola writh in agony. Rincon runs to Mottola, kneeling next to him. Mottola looks up at Rincon, fear in his eyes. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, son. I got you.

Rincon starts to PULL Mottola TOWARD THE OFF-RAMP... Struggling to get him to safety. Mottola's body starts to convulse. Rincon stops, tries to control him. Sees Mottola's eyes rolling back in his head Then Rincon is horrified when he looks up to see... ALIENS RACING FORWARD... Heading his way! Moving in and out of the sea of abandoned cars. Rincon redoubles his efforts, pulling on the injured Mott As he does, he looks back up to see... The ALIENS ARE ALMOST ON TOP OF HIM now as... BANG! The first alien is shot by... Nantz, suddenly there, M-16 poised. Rincon looks from Nantz to... MORE ALIENS coming at them! No choice-- Rincon PICKS UP the injured Mottola's RIFLE. Scared, but resolute. He looks at Nantz. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I need to know? The slightest beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: It's set to fire in three round bursts. We're low, so don't waste your shots. Rincon holds the M-16 against his shoulder, aiming. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sight down the barrel...?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: And give 'em hell. Rincon sights down the barrel of his rifle at ONE ALIEN i the distance. He squeezes the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FREEWAY OFF-RAMP
dialogues.text: Adukwu sees Rincon and the wounded Mottola now. He runs t them, incoming rounds WHIZZ by as...

Adukwu bends over Mottola, seeing that he's dead. Adukwu closes Mottola's eyes as... An ALIEN APPEARS from behind a car, AIMING STRAIGHT AT ADUKWU. It is about to FIRE as... BAM! BAM! BAM! Rincon FIRES, blowing the alien away. Adukwu looks up, realizing Rincon just saved him. He,meets eyes with Rincon, who stares back, stunned a mom by his own actions. Adukwu immediately shouts a. warning.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. ADUKWU
dialogues.text: Keep fighting! Rincon snaps back, turns to fire... A moment too late as. THUMP! Rincon is HIT. He falls. Adukwu grabs Rincon, sees the pain and fear in the civili eyes. Adukwu rips open packages of QuickClot, begins spreading the fast-clotting powder on Rincon's wounds as.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris and Imlay firing... From this height, they can see full expanse of freeway: More WAVES OF ALIENS coming, using abandoned cars as cove

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Shit, Lieutenant, we're gonna be overrun !

dialogues.speaker: BY THE BUS / ON FREEWAY
dialogues.text: Nantz and Martinez exchange a desperate glance on this. T Nantz. looks around, assessing the situation.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Gimme two of your smoke cannisters! Martinez pops two canisters off, hands them to Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Take someone to cover you!. Nantz turns, sees Correggio. Then he turns the other way, sees Kerns.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Kerns! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Me, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I'm not worried about fightin' next to you, Kerns. Now let's go. A slight smile from Kerns on this as he follows Nantz... Who sprints low, scurrying between cars... 10... 20... 30 yards closer to the enemy. Nantz and Kerns arrive at a large SUV. Kerns ducks low, covering Nantz. Nantz crouches, opens th gas tank... Unscrews the fuse from the smoke grenade body, tossing th canister aside... pulls the pin... flips the 'spoon' off.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Get ready to move on my word. Nantz holds the fuse over the open gas cap.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Now! Nantz drops the fuse into the gas tank. They go RUNNING BACK TOWARD THE BUS as... B0000M! The SUV EXPLODES in a ball of flames! Nantz and Kerns dive BEHIND ANOTHER VEHICLE, Kerns crouch laying cover fire. Nantz pulls a fuse.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Again! Ready?!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: (pops up, fires) Ready! Nantz drops the fuse, they run... The CAR EXPLODES in fla Nantz runs to ANOTHER CAR, making sure Kerns is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris and Imlay see what Nantz is doing...
He's creating a WALL OF FLAME... Funneling the enemy into one NARROW CORRIDOR! Forcing them through the OPENING between the CARS ON FIRE

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Damn, Sergeant sure as shit's ninja. He just gave us a kill zone, didn't he, Corporal?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Soon as they come through, blow 'em back to hell! The first alien appears THROUGH THE BURNING CORRIDOR. Iml blows it away! Harris blows away the next... It's working

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Kerns fall back BEHIND THE BUS, next to Martine Correggio and a 2nd squad marine. Along with Harris and Imlay on the bus roof, they are the only ones left holding the aliens off. All FIRE forward a More and more aliens begin pouring through, braving the flames... Into the line of fire... Many aliens go down. But because of their sheer numbers, few start to make it through, FIRING BACK at the marines. Martinez sees the 2nd SQUAD MARINE go down in front of hi Martinez rushes to his side... HE'S DEAD. Martinez rises to shoot and...THWUMMP. Martinez is hit. He looks down, blood running over his belt. Shock on his face. He's been shot in the stomach. Martinez looks around... The remaining aliens now only cars apart from them. Two forces taking cover behind spraying glass and punctur metal, firing directly into the faces of their enemy. Martinez pulls himself together, struggling over to Nantz

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: Pull the men back... Pull 'em all back now, Sergeant. I'm gonna stay and cover.
Nantz looks at Martinez about to say something. Sees the blood draining from his stomach, down his legs. Nantz grabs Martinez, pulling him up.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. We gotta get you outta here. No way we're leavin' you...

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: I said I got it...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving you here to die.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: That's not your call, Sergeant. Now get your men outta here... He pushes Nantz away, looks around, the chaos slowing dow for him. He reaches into his vest... Martinez hands the LETTER we saw earlier to Nantz. A mome between them. Nantz nods, then spins, moving, yelling to the men.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're pulling back. Head to the lower street, now! NOW! Nantz runs toward the edge of the destroyed off-ramp, lay cover as the men head down. Harris and Imlay slide down off the roof of the bus, join the others running to the off-ramp. Correggio sees... MARTINEZ STAYING BEHIND, shooting at the aliens, drawing their fire.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: (TO NANTZ)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Keep movin', corporal! Go! All the men climb DOWN THE OFF-RAMP. Nantz turns to go ba to get the Lieutenant himself, sees... Martinez hauling himself toward the rear of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martinez, behind the back of the bus, struggles to breath still drawing fire. Grabs his radio.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: (TRANSMITTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lieutenant Bennie Martinez', U.S. Marine Corps! Aliens converge toward the back of the bus. Ten... Fifteen... Twenty ALIENS heading for the signal... Heading for Martinez.

dialogues.speaker: LT. MARTINEZ
dialogues.text: (TRANSMITTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1st Platoon, 2nd Battalion, 5th Marines! He turns, sees Nantz coming back for him... Martinez pulls a smoke canister from his vest... Holds it for Nantz to see... Then unscrews the fuse, pops open the gas cap of the bus. ALIENS CLOSE IN ON MARTINEZ... Nantz turns, dives for cover as... Martinez drops the fuse into the gas tank... A flash of fear across his face as... Aliens are on him a

dialogues.speaker: KABOOOOOOOOOOOOM
dialogues.text: Massive fire ball shooting 300 feet into the sky'! Nantz raises his head, debris raining down, sees... ALL THE ALIENS DEAD. His eyes wide at Martinez's sacrifice, the burden now on he's in charge of the men, the civilians... Nantz gets to his feet. Runs for the off-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz drops down the destroyed off-ramp... Runs to the marines and civilians BEHIND THE ABANDONED VAN. He sees Adukwu working on Rincon, Hector crying in Michele's arms

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Package Mr. Rincon for transport. We've got to move...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Sergeant. Did you just leave Lt. Martinez back there?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Lt. Martinez stayed behind. He knew he was dying...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: So you left him? Is that how it is with you?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: He sacrificed himself to save our asses. (steps to Correggio) Now you get your head straight, Corporal. This is my unit now. Nantz looks at the men, who stare back, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Let's move. We need shelter... Those bombs are gonna drop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frantic dash through the street, rubble and fires all o Marines carry the kids. HECTOR, in Harris' arms, head swiveling, eyes searching for his dad, sees... Imlay and Adukwu CARRYING rINCON, who appears lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, empty store. The marines burst in, aiming rifles.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Tighten this place down. See if we can establish communications. Hard line only! Nothing wireless.
The marines move into position, covering windows and door Nantz turns to Michele, huddling with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Listen, we're out of the bomb zone... But when they fall, we will definitely be rocked. Make sure the kids are prepared for that. Hector suddenly breaks free, rushing forward.as Imlay and Adukwu enter with Rincon, setting him down. Nantz pulls blankets from a nearby rack, covering Rincon. he does, we see a glimpse of Rincon's BLOOD-SOAKED CLOTHI He is very pale. Blood flecks his lips. Hector stares into his father's face, eyes filling. Rinco touches Hector's face lightly.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: It'll be okay. We'll get your dad fixed up. But when Hector looks to Nantz on this, he can't meet the boy's gaze. Hector can see this isn't the truth. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, son. I'm not going to make it. (a slight beat) But you will. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go without you. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But you have to. Now wait with Michele a minute. Let me talk to the sergeant. Reluctantly, Hector allows Michele to lead him away.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Mr. Rincon, we can take you and... Rincon turns to Nantz, steel-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. RINCON
dialogues.text: Don't waste time, sergeant. You and I both know what's going on here.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I can't leave you... RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't take me. Nantz is silent, at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STORE
dialogues.text: Imlay stares at a CLOCK on the wall, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Four minutes and those bombs drop, Sergeant. NANTZ looks over at this. But his expression is blank. He turns back to Rincon, who's staring straight into him. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep playing it over in my head... If I'd done things differently... Maybe I could have gotten Hector out earlier.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You can't look back. You make the best decision you can... A beat. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just promise you'll get my son out of here, Sergeant. Nantz looks like he has the weight of the world on him.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I promise. Rincon holds out his hand. Nantz takes it, meeting his ga RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trusting you with the only thing I have in this world. Nantz stares, nods.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Sergeant! Hard wire connection!

Nantz turns to see Harris behind a COUNTER, at a COMPUTER an INTERNET CONNECTION on its screen. The marines crowd around, reading the ominous HEADLINE... "GLOBAL INVASION -- Alien 'Creatures' Attack From Oceans" PICTURES of ALIENS racing through urban streets, swarming over cars stuck in massive lines,of traffic... Underneath these pictures we see CAPTIONS, a litany-of do Battle: Tokyo... Battle: Cape Town... Battle: Los Angeles Then a BUDDY LIST pops up on the screen, an INSTANT MESSA 'baby, is that you?'

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Damn, that's Cherise... Harris quickly types back a response: 'you ok?' The message comes back: no, real scared.' Harris responds: 'where are you?' He hits SEND. But the message doesn't go through. He clic the mouse. But the computer has frozen. Then 'Internet Connection Lost' pops up on screen. Everyone stares. Harris stands, walks from the computer. Stavrou watches him go as...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE BIG 5 FLOOR
dialogues.text: HECTOR steps back to his dad's side. Rincon's eyes open slowly. He looks at Hector. Manages a small smile. Reache out, wipes a tear from his son's face. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very proud of you, son. You're being so brave... Hector throws his arms around his father, hugging him tightly. RINCON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Hector. Mr. Rincon smiles. His face peaceful. Hector is silent, tears rolling down his face.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Get away from the windows! Get those kids behind cover! The marines back away from the windows into the center of store, hunkering down with the civilians. Everyone stares the CLOCK on the wall as it ticks...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: C'mon. Fry those bastards...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Those bombs drop, then everything's gonna change. Get to the FOB, get some goddamn ammo...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Some goddamn food...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Some goddamn tanks. Beat. Everyone stares as... The CLOCK ticks to NINE... AND NOTHING HAPPENS. They wait. Fear grows on everyone's faces.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: They shoulda' dropped, right? We'd feel it from here, wouldn't we?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: That much ordinance? They'd feel it in Nevada. Something's wrong...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Maybe it's good... Maybe we turned the tide...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, Imlay... 'Cause we were kickin' ass out there. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening, Sergeant? What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I don't know.
Adukwu quietly approaches Nantz now, voice low.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. ADUKWU
dialogues.text: Sergeant... Mr. Rincon is dead. Nantz turns, staring off at Hector, sitting by his father It's all too much...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Jesus... Nantz takes a deep breath, his mind racing, the world clo in on him. He turns to Michele.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Listen, our Forward Operating Base is about a mile away. We have to go on foot. I'll need your help with Hector now. Michele nods. Watches as Nantz slowly walks to Hector. Nantz kneels by the boy.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Hector. Your dad... didn't make it. You understand? Hector, sobbing, overwhelmed by grief and fear, looks up Nantz. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna be here. I want my dad back. I want it all to go back to the way it was before... AT. THE FRONT OF THE STORE. Stavrou, eyes on the still street, sees... TWO ALIEN SCOUTS appear. They crouch by a car.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Sergeant, we got hostiles in front. All the marines stiffen, the clatter of rifles being rais But Nantz, tearing up himself, just stays focused on Hect

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Me too, Hector. I wish it could go back, too...

dialogues.speaker: STAVROU LOOKS OUT TO THE STREET
dialogues.text: MORE ALIENS appear now, moving TOWARD THE STORE.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Out of time, sergeant. NANTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to lead Hector away. Hector struggles.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (URGENTLY NOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go, Hector. HECTOR (CRYING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! I want my dad!!! Nantz lifts Hector. We see Hector's face, stricken, stari back at his father as he's carried off. The other marines gather up Michele and the girls... And everyone is moving silently THROUGH THE STORE as...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT OF THE STORE
dialogues.text: CRASH! The plate glass window is SHATTERED as... An ALIEN smashes through it. The alien is very still, peering around. Then it begins t creep forward as... A SECOND ALIEN, then a third, a FOURTH follows, leaping i the store with sinewy power.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REAR OF THE STORE
dialogues.text: Nantz peers out a BACK DOOR. It's clear. They MOVE OUT ju as... MORE ALIENS leap in. They move in formation THROUGH THE STORE as... THE BACK DOOR silently shuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nantz and the others slip out of the back...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stavrou, Harris.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Blow something up.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant. As the others RACE AWAY down the alley... Stavrou takes his rifle butt, SMASHES the WINDOW of a nea CAR. Reaches in... Jams the car's gear into.neutral. As the massive Stavrou pushes the car AGAINST THE STORE'S BACK DOOR... Harris pulls his KA-BAR FIGHTING KNIFE. Harris.slides UNDER THE CAR... Punctures the GAS TANK. As Harris rolls away from the FLOW OF GASOLINE... Stavrou LIGHTS it. Both men RUN DOWN THE ALLEY.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Don't think they'll be comin' out that way... As... BOOM! The car, blocking the door, goes up in FLAMES

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Stavrou and Harris FALL BEHIND A BUILDING with the others NANTZ, still holding Hector, looks off to a SIDE STREET.. signals to Kerns and Correggio.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Check it out. The two marines run down the alley to the SIDE STREET. Nantz sets Hector down. Looks the boy in the face.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: This is the hardest thing you'll ever have to do... Michele, arms around Kirsten and Amy, watches Nantz.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: But we'll get through it together. I promise, Hector. Hector nods, still crying. Nantz exchanges a glance with Michele, who moves to Hector, comforting him. Nantz steps away as Kerns and Correggio run up, reporting

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Looks good, both directions. Out of earshot of the civilians, Nantz spins to his men w fiery intensity.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We are not losing one more of these civilians. Period. Am I making myself clear? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move. The group jogs silently DOWN THE ALLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz leads the group down the residential street, tidy bungalows on either side.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: You okay, bro?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: I hadn't a pushed Cherise to get married, she'd still be in Chicago. Suddenly, Nantz stops, fist raised. The squad halts as... A SOUND fades in, a deep RUMBLING. The marines FALL BEHIND CARS now, pulling the civilians d with them as the RUMBLING continues to BUILD.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Under the cars! Now! The marines frantically shed their packs, squirming UNDER CARS with the civilians, pulling the kids under as...

Rounds the corner in the distance, THOUSANDS'OF THEM, fil the street from sidewalk to sidewalk. An army on the move NANTZ DRAGS HECTOR UNDER ONE CAR with him,' pulls the boy close, gets his legs under the car, under cover, just as. The mass of aliens SWARM PAST, the ground shaking, RUMBLI The humans HUDDLE UNDER THE CARS, peering out to see the and arms of the aliens flying by. Some bound OVER THE CAR which bounce up and down, BANGING with the aliens' weight The RUMBLING EBBS as the aliens disappear into the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad moves in formation, surrounding the civilians. Little Kirsten comes up behind Correggio. He's surprised she slips her hand into his. Correggio looks down, seeing how scared she is. He smiles, grips her hand tightly. Up ahead, Nantz leads, MAP in hand.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: How far, sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: One block over. Imlay smiles at Kerns.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: We'.re gonna make it! Dude, we're gonna make it... But as they approach a CORNER... Nantz stops, exchanges a glance with his corporals. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: The smell. An ominous beat. The squad moves down the dark street as. ASH FLOATS DOWN here from the sky... Like a beautiful ear winter snow...

We slowly MOVE IN TIGHTER and TIGHTER on Nantz. Until we are CLOSE ON NANTZ' FACE. A REDDISH GLOW is reflected there. Nantz stops, looking horrified. We REVERSE to see... A DEEP BLACK COLUMN OF SMOKE rising into the night sky fr NUMEROUS FIRES that rage within the fence line of... SANTA MONICA AIRPORT. As they approach the Forward Operating Base, the devastat is slowly revealed: CRASHED F-18 JETS and COBRA HELICOPTERS line the runways. BODIES and SMOLDERING MARINE VEHICLES litter the airfield

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Jesus... They wiped our Forward Operating Base right off the map.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Now we know why those bombs never dropped. They took our jets out.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: This was a dug-in marine Corps position that had armor, air and ground. Maybe we got nothing left to fight with... Michele MEETS EYES WITH NANTZ. His look tells us everythi THEY'RE LOSING THIS WAR. Nantz turns, spies an AIRPORT FIRE STATION by the runways

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Let's get under cover. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines enter cautiously, rifles up. Then they hustle the civilians inside when it appears safe.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Lock this place down. The marines fan out, securing doors, checking windows as. Nantz kneels by Hector, tries to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You're a brave kid. When this is over, you're going to be a hero. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People always say that. "He's a hero." (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one even knows what a hero is.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Your dad was a hero. Hector just stares back.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: He saved Pvt. Adukwu up on that freeway. Hector exchanges a glance with Adukwu. Something passes between them... One man died so another could live...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: You save a marine under fire, you get a medal, y'know. Nantz pulls out a MEDALLION, the CREST of the 2/5 on it.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: This is our medallion. It's yours. For your dad. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 2/5 now, Hector. Hector takes the heavy medallion, looks it over, pointing the 2/5 MOTTO on it: HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean, "retreat hell?"

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: During World War I, an officer from our regiment was ordered to retreat. He said, "Retreat? Hell, we just got here!" Nantz is happy to see a slow smile from Hector now. Harris calls out:

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: We're secure, sergeant.
Nantz stands on this, addresses the marines:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Listen up. We need ammo. Kerns, Adukwu stay with the civilians. The rest of us, let's move. Nantz puts a hand on Hector's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black plumes of SMOKE fill the night sky as Nantz and his head silently toward the bodies of dead marines and alien The tarmac is a smoldering WASTELAND: Empty, bombed-out buildings on its outskirts, burning aircraft and vehicles litter the runways. Fires crackle. As they go, the marines rifle the pockets and pouches of their fallen comrades, pulling out any available ammo. IMLAY whispers a low, heartfelt refrain to the dead marin he searches.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Sorry, bro. He moves on to another fallen marine, searching.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Sorry, bro. Across the runway, Nantz pulls ammo from the pouch of a d marine. Then looking up, he sees... A LAV-25 ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER. INTACT. Nantz moves to it. Then turns. A LOW WHISTLE from him and the marines look up. They hustle to Nantz. Everyone gives the LAV an excited once-over.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Looks like it just rolled off the goddamn assembly line!

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Good job, Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (TO STAVROU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you drive this thing?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Hell, if it's got an engine, sergeant, I can drive it.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Good. Get it running.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Seems like vehicles are targets...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: A minivan's a target, Correggio. A LAV with a Bushmaster chaingun... That's an asset. Imlay grins. Nantz motions to him, starting off.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: (FOLLOWING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Where, sergeant? Nantz points to the CONTROL TOWER, its windows blown out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: High ground. We need to see the big picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerns has a tub of ice cream, scooping bowls for the kids

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: My dad's a fireman. They love their ice cream. Used to visit the firehouse with my little brother, they always had tons of it... (re. the kids) My brother's not much older than these guys. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look much older, either. She gazes at the kids, pain and anger washing over her.
MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this day ever going to end?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Maybe the Sergeant'll find a way outta here. MICHELE (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with you guys anyway? Doesn't anybody have a first name? ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmanuel. Manny.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Pete. You married? Family? MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm single. Lots of family back in Nebraska, though... Hopefully they're safe... She shakes the thought away. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you guys?

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Little Rock. ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigeria. I came here to be a doctor. MICHELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be a surgeon, the way you cut into that thing... Adukwu smiles. Then his smile fades as he looks around. ADUKWU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz enters with Imlay. They look around... The WINDOWS have been BLOWN OPEN. The wind rustles papers through the ghostly space, blowing them out into the nigh

On one desk, a COMPUTER is flashing a SLIDESHOW: Happy PICTURES of someone's family vacation. From this, high vantage point, they can see for miles... Nantz looks out one end of the control tower, sees all th way to the ocean... Then he turns, looks the other way, dead east... A vista of EXPLOSIONS, spreading-into the distance. ALIEN DRONE AIRCRAFT engage F-18s. One jet is blown up, spirall to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Look how far east they've gotten. That's almost the whole city... Nantz looks out through BINOCULARS: Sees the HOLLYWOOD SIGN ablaze in the hills... Then pans to a mid-city area. Stops when he sees one quadrant of the city, blocks wide, SHIMMERING an INKY BLA Some kind of DARK ENERGY WAVE emanating from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What the hell's that? Imlay peers out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: There's zero activity there. And the area does seem completely devoid of activity-- No alien or human aircraft above it. Like a DEAD ZONE.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, Sergeant? Nantz, panning with the binoculars, sees a CHOPPER TAKING in the distance now. Nantz grabs a MAP on the desk, eyes roaming over it. Then looks back to where he saw the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: That must be the alternate extraction site. Maybe we can evacuate the civilians there... He turns to Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Get them in the LAV. I'll radio for an evac helicopter... When I do, they'll be coming, so we have to move fast.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Think we can make it, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're gonna give it one helluva try, Imlay. He reassures the young marine with each-word:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're not dying here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines, absent Nantz, surround the civilians protectively as they hustle them into the LAV.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL TOWER
dialogues.text: Nantz standing alone with a RADIO PACK looking out into t black night, wind blowing through the tower. The LAV WAITS ON THE TARMAC below, engine running. Nantz takes a deep breath. Presses the button on the RADI NANTZ (TRANSMITTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any station, this is Foxtrot 2 November. I have four civilians and seven marines, we're heading to Alternate Extraction Point Charlie. Requesting evacuation. I say again, this is Foxtrot 2 November heading to Alternate Extraction Point Charlie. Out. Nantz turns immediately, hurrying out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz runs from the tower and climbs into the LAV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz sees the civilians and marines crammed together in back amid gear and guns. He turns to Stavrou behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Use the thermal sight. No lights. Stavrou drives, spins away as Nantz climbs...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE TURRET
dialogues.text: He mans the M-240 MACHINE GUN. Imlay beside him on the 25 BUSHMASTER CHAIN GUN. Headlights off, running dark, Stavrou drives, peering thr the THERMAL SIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washed green, the city a war zone, massive destruction.. An ALIEN DRONE winging toward the airport as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAV moves fast in total darkness down a car-strewn street. Santa Monica Airport fading behind them, suddenly BOOOOOOM-! Bright burst of light! And the Control Tower explodes in a ball of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz watches the alien drone fly off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles away, the LAV drives through a CITY STREET, surroun by TALL BUILDINGS, the area a desolate wasteland now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou drives, hands gripping the wheel as he maneuvers carefully through wrecked abandoned cars.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TURRET
dialogues.text: Nantz eyes a nervous Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Extract site's only a couple more miles, Imlay. Imlay nods back. Nantz peers down to... STAVROU, BEHIND THE WHEEL... Eyes focusing tensely through the thermal sight scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green wash of the city passing by. Tall, empty buildings around... Suddenly, a big DARK OBJECT in the street! Stavrou SLAMS THE BRAKES. Civilians and marines in the ti passenger compartment are thrown around. Right in front of the LAV... A massive CRATER. The street's impassable.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We gotta go around. The LAV backs up, Nantz scanning the sky, gripping the M- machine gun, trying to see out into the darkness... Then they TURN A CORNER... And a VIEW BETWEEN TWO TALL BUILDINGS is harrowing... FOUR ALIEN DRONE AIRCRAFT hovering... Then turning. Flyin toward them.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Get ready, Imlay. Here they come. Stavrou looks out to see... A HELICOPTER in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Think I see our ride, sergeant! SGT NANTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us there. Cause we're about to get lit up. The alien drone ships are winging at them. They are only meters out when...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: See what that Bushmaster can do, Imlay! Imlay OPENS UP on the 25MM BUSHMASTER CHAIN GUN.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Come on, you martian bastards! The Bushmaster is a rapid-firing CANNON spewing 200 round minute, each capable of destroying a light tank. For once, the aliens are overmatched. The ALIEN SHIPS tak HEAVY FIRE from the Bushmaster... One goes down IN FLAMES, the others PEEL OFF, flying behi buildings.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Where'd they go? Where'd they go? Nantz is scanning the sky, then...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Imlay, on your six! Imlay spins in the turret, picking up... The three remaining ALIEN AIRCRAFT coming back around. The lead alien ship FIRES! A ,CAR EXPLODES next to the LAV. Imlay rocks in the turre

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Son of a... Imlay targets, fires the Bushmaster... The lead alien ship is HIT, winging out of control INTO A SECOND SHIP. The TWO SHIPS EXPLODE into a building as... The FINAL ALIEN AIRCRAFT dodges the FIREBALL, flying stra at the LAV...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Getting close, Imlay...

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: I got it. Imlay FIRES a burst. The last aircraft is hit...
It PINWHEELS TO THE GROUND, exploding into FLAMING WRECKA which hurtles RIGHT AT THE LAV.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stand on it, Stavrou! Stavrou pushes it, TRYING TO OUTRUN the burning wreckage. Which is almost on top of the LAV as... Stavrou spins AROUND A CORNER, escaping. The wreckage explodes into a building behind them as... THUMP - THUMP - THUMP! The sound of a UH-1'Medevac ECHOES

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: The chopper! Nantz looks out, sees the CHOPPER LANDING in the street. The LAV screeches up amid the RUBBLE and SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Last stop!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Everybody out! The marines rush the civilians OUT OF THE LAV... Nantz an Imlay scrambling out last.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Pretty decent shooting, Imlay.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, you did it, sergeant! We're gonna get these people out! EVERYONE RUNS TO THE CHOPPER. The marines begin loading the civilians in, the old-schoo CREW CHIEF hopping off to help the kids in. CREW CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in the middle of the shit, Sergeant! Everything's been pulled back.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!
CREW CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost most of our air assets. We're abandoning Los Angeles. This city's done...! (to the pilot) Let's go! The chopper powers up, Nantz SCRAMBLES ON with the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHOPPER BEGINS TO LIFT OFF. As it rises, Nantz gazes at the CITYSCAPE. He sees fires, wreckage everywhere. The he looks off to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK DEAD ZONE SHIMMERING NEARBY
dialogues.text: Nantz watches the HELICOPTER BANK TOWARD THE BLACK ZONE. as it gets closer... The HELICOPTER DIPS precipitously, suddenly losing altitu The kids SCREAM. The marines hang on. Nantz sees the PILOT STRUGGLING with the controls. The HELICOPTER'S GAUGES are going crazy. The pilot BANKS HARD AWAY from the area, reversing course And the helicopter STABILIZES.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?! CREW CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something there was playing hell with our power! Nantz stares at this. Then notices Hector watching. him. He sees the 2/5 MEDALLION clutched tightly in Hector's ha Sees the words "Retreat Hell." Nantz looks back at the MYSTERIOUS BLACK PATCH of citysca Then he turns to the crew chief.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Set us back down! CREW CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! The other marines in Nantz' unit look over, alarmed now.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We need to recon that area! CREW CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't land! May not have power to take off again... Nantz looks out. Spies a BUILDING with a FLAT OPEN ROOF. points to it.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Then we'll rope down!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: What the hell, sergeant? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: There's something over there... We could be the only ones left here to figure out what it is. (to the others) Let's go, marines. The marines look frightened, confused. They start to pull themselves up. ROPES are dropped from the chopper as it hovers over the building...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: NOW! Go! Go! The marines start to RAPPEL DOWN, one after another as... Nantz exchanges a glance with Michele.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: They'll get you safe. He smiles at the girls. Then turns, nods at Hector. Puts hand on his shoulder. A BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: See you soon, buddy. HECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We're gonna fight. Nantz turns, grabs a ROPE, drops out of the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the chopper hovers, Nantz drops to the roof, hunkers d with the other marines. Nantz watches the evac helicopter fly off to safety. Then he turns to the marines, who stare back hopelessly, clearly at their lowest point.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: Why'd we get off the chopper, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: 'Cause we have a job to do.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: But we were getting out...!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: You have some hunch and now we're stuck out here in the shit?!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: That's right. This fight's not over.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Sergeant's gonna get us killed! Just like my brother. A beat. Nantz eyes Correggio. It's laid open now.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Believe me, Correggio, I grieved for every marine I ever lost... Nantz looks around now, from marine to marine.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: But we are in the fight of our lives right now. And our duty is to keep moving forward. Keep fighting. That's how we honor men like your brother, Correggio. And Lt. Martinez. And Hector's father, who saved Adukwu's life. He wasn't trained for that. He just picked up a rifle and did what needed to be done. If a civilian can do that... (MORE)
SGT. NANTZ (cont'd) Well then I better square my shit away and do whatever I have to do to defeat this enemy. But I can't do it alone. Nantz stares. The tension is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I need you men. And maybe we'll die fighting today. Not because we're heroes. But because we're goddamn United States marines, and always will be. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to give my full measure for you. I'm hoping you'll do the same for me. A BEAT, glances exchanged. THEN ALL THE MARINES RISE AS O

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Sergeant. We'll follow you to hell and back. Nantz smiles, nods.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Good. 'Cause that's where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad is moving in unison, covering all around, approaching the LAV. They jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stavrou fires it up, drives off as... Nantz eyes the jumb of gear. He grabs his COMBAT SHOTGUN, a portable RADIO, which he makes sure is OFF... Then an olive case marked: GLTD. He stuffs it in his pack

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Laser target, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Might have to get some cruise missiles in here.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Shit, yes, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostiles. Twelve o'clock. Nantz looks up to see... ALIEN SOLDIERS appearing on the street now. Nantz goes back to stuffing his pack.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Just hit the gas, Corporal. We got plenty of armor. Everyone looks up at this. Then looks out to see... The aliens attacking, FIRING on the LAV as... Stavrou floors it, ALIEN FIRE pinging off the LAV's armor as... SPLAT!!! STAVROU MOWS THROUGH THE ENEMY LINE. Nantz looks out the back to see some ALIENS STAGGERING AW

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Reverse, Corporal.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Aye, aye, Sergeant. As he BACKS UP, mowing back over the remaining aliens... marines cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAV cruises slowly. Nantz stares forward. The BLACK DEAD ZONE looms ahead... As they get closer, it seems like the whole area is absent of light. A black hol Nantz stares out, about to answer when the LAV LURCHES, t lurches again. Stavrou REVS the engine.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: Losing power, Sergeant. Gauges are dropping... losing voltage... The LAV slows. The engine skips. Then the LAV DIES.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Stavrou?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: She's dead, Sergeant. Nantz looks around, warily. The streets are quiet, desert

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: All right, dismount. Grab anything you think we can use. The men nod, and move OUT OF THE LAV to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correggio and Kerns on one side of the street, Stavrou an Harris on the other. Imlay with Adukwu. Nantz watches his men move forward, covering each other's advance. Scanning the buildings, searching for targets... Then Nantz halts them. They crouch together, peering at.. The middle of the DEAD ZONE just ahead of them. It is ver dark. No lights are visible from any source. The men SWEA

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Hot as hell here.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: No lights.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. ADUKWU
dialogues.text: My watch stopped.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Something's generating heat. Messing with our electronics. Sucking up all the power... Nantz scans the street. The sweat dripping into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Where would you put a critical asset if you wanted to protect it? Or hide it?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Underground. Nantz points to A SUBWAY ENTRANCE AHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad runs to the subway entrance, stopping just insi

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Harris, Adukwu, stay here, watch the street. Harris and Adukwu nod. Taking position at the entrance. Nantz motions to the others.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Let's go. Nantz leads Stavrou, Correggio, Kerns and Imlay down the stopped escalator to the SUBWAY PLATFORM. Nantz stands, gazing around at the empty subway platform. Silent. Spooky. A train is stopped. Doors open. It is dark, the only light bleeding in from the street above. He motions Stavrou to guard against anything coming from above. Then he moves forward with the others. A huge number of BIRDS line the dark cavity above the tra tracks, taking cover themselves, roosting quietly. Nantz sees a DOOR in the tunnel wall, heads to it. He pulls his KA-BAR KNIFE out, sticks the blade into the jam, pops the DOOR OPEN. Nantz turns to Correggio and Ker

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two stay here, watch our backs. (TO IMLAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imlay, come with me. Nantz and Imlay slip through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Imlay stand very still, peering down the long, hall, looking for movement. Nantz motions and they move forward silently, guns ready. They turn a corner and stop. It is PITCH BLACK here. Nantz clicks on his flashlight. They move forward. After only a few feet, the FLASHLIGHT DIMS AND DIES. Imlay clicks on his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Save it. Something is killing anything electronic we use. Imlay clicks his flashlight OFF. But now we see... A dim light ahead. Nantz and Imlay creep forward, very slowly. Turn a corner, see... A STRANGE LIGHT at the end of the hallway. THE LIGHT GLOW fiercely, as if it's shining through the floor. Nantz, silhouetted by the light, signals Imlay to stay pu Nantz steps forward, toward the strange glow of light. As approaches, he realizes it's coming through... An IRON GRATE in the floor. Nantz moves to the grate, kneels, PEERING DOWN INTO...

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE SUBWAY TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Fifty feet wide, the dim tunnel has been further EXCAVATE It is a huge CAVERN now, extending off into the distance further than Nantz can see. The huge space is illuminated by MASSES OF ALIEN MACHINER An ELECTRIC HUM FILLS THE AIR. Tending the machinery: DOZENS OF ALIENS, bigger than the others. One of the ALIENS TURNS, focusing up, right at Nantz. Nantz spins, runs back into the darkness. Calling to Imla

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Run, Imlay! Run! BANG. The iron GRATE FLIES into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Imlay, race along in the dark. They hear POUNDI FOOTSTEPS of the alien pursuing him. A glimmer of LIGHT ahead. Along the floor. It is, a DOOR. They burst through a DOOR, into... A DIM STAIRWELL.

Nantz follows Imlay UP THE STAIRS as... The STAIRWELL DOOR below is SMASHED OPEN. Nantz spins, swinging his shotgun. HE FIRES. BOOM! The blast ILLUMINATES the huge ALIEN, filling the stairwell with its horrible bulk. Nantz backs up the stairs, pumping the shotgun, firing... Each blast ILLUMINATES THE ALIEN in a STROBE EFFECT. The alien moves up the stares. Nantz KEEPS FIRING. The NOISE IS DEAFENING in the enclosed space. Then the SHOTGUN RUNS DRY. And we're left IN DARKNESS. Imlay clicks on his FLASHLIGHT, revealing... The ALIEN at Nantz' feet, its strange "hand" on his boot. Nantz, terrified, aims at the alien, waiting to see if it will move. It doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz and Imlay re-enter, running up to join the others. Up the stairs, by street-level, Harris and Adukwu keep wa Harris motions: "ENEMY TROOPS". Nantz nods. Signals for all the marines to head down the stairs. The marines gather around Nantz. To Harris:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Hard to tell. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I think I got their attention. Nantz kneels. He opens his pack, pulls out the radio and case marked GLTD.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Look. There's something big down in the tunnels. It's sucking up a lot of power, could be a major Command &.Control asset.
Nantz stares at his men.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: We need to destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. KERNS
dialogues.text: But we got no jets left, right, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Hopefully, they can still fire cruise missiles from Pendleton or Vandenburg... I'll radio in a strike, paint the target from the street. You know what that means. The man nod solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: We gotta hold 'em off long enough to paint the target.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. STAVROU
dialogues.text: If we can get a transmission out before the radio dies...

dialogues.speaker: CPL. HARRIS
dialogues.text: And the targeting laser lasts long enough for command to get a lock on the target.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Hell, dying's easy, ladies. Everything else takes balls, right? They all laugh softly.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Let's do it. He takes a deep breath, raises the radio, and TRANSMITS:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (TRANSMITTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any station, this is Foxtrot 2 November. Priority Fire Mission. I have identified a major enemy command and control asset-- located grid 459083. 1 WILL BE LASING.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Foxtrot 2. You have visual confirmation of this C&C asset? We can't waste resources.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Affirmative. They're building a huge complex underground... I think it's the head of the snake. Repeat. I will be... THE RADIO GOES DEAD. Alien fire EXPLODES now, rocking the station. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Nantz and the marines cover their heads as the station starts to come apart, chunks of concrete f The walls crack. Dust fills the air. Nantz SCREAMS as a chunk of concrete FALLS ACROSS HIS ANK Then, it's over. All is silent. Nantz, GRIMACING in PAIN, strains to lift the concrete chunk off his ankle. He GROA The marines rise. Pale, sweating, Nantz hobbles to his fe He slings his rifle, and carrying the GLTD, hurries on hi bad ankle to the stairs. Nantz looks up. Rubble nearly fills the stairway. There i only a small opening of daylight near the ceiling. The men all unclip their web gear, begin climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chunk of rubble falls from the pile at the subway entra and Nantz emerges, rolling down the pile to the street. The other marines follow, set up a perimeter as..,. Nantz takes cover behind a berm of rubble, DROPPING down, flattening himself to the ground. He sets the GLTD (LASER DESIGNATOR) up on top of the pile Nantz removes his flack jacket and places it over the las designator.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go...

Nantz switches on the TARGETING LASER. A RED BEAM OF LIGHT shoots from the designator to a fixed point in the center of the street. Nantz looks up to see... The street fill with ALIEN SOLDIERS rushing out now.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Here they come! The marines FORM A PERIMETER AROUND THE LASER, OPENING UP the aliens as... The mass of aliens surges forward like a wave.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Hold them back! We have to keep the laser on target! Nantz FIRES. An alien goes down. He picks another target and FIRES. The alien staggers, keeps coming. Three more rounds and the alien goes down. But the rest KEEP COMING... closing in... FOLLOWING THE BEAM OF THE LASER BACK TO NANTZ. Nantz is picking his targets. AIMING, FIRING... Turning, finding targets, reloading, the aliens getting closer... Then his rifle runs dry. NANTZ pulls his sidearm. He aim, FIRES, shooting a closin alien in its 'heart.' It drops. Rounds impact around Nantz as he shoots another alien... Then the next. The next. Then his sidearm is out of bulle as... An EXPLOSION rips near Nantz. Knocking the laser away. Nantz struggles...TO THE LASER. RE-AIMING it as... MORE ALIENS POUR INTO THE STREET. The marines are pushed into a SMALL CIRCLE around the las Fighting nearly back to back.

Kerns is HIT. He is thrown to the ground, but is back up, arm bleeding, firing. An alien RUSHES AT CORREGGIO who spins just in time, FIRI repeatedly until the alien goes down. Stavrou swings his rifle butt, SMASHING another alien. It staggers back. Stavrou puts numerous rounds into it. An alien reaches ADUKWU, knocking him to the ground, abou blast him... Harris runs the alien through with his bayonet, twisting firing his rifle at the same time. The alien falls. The marines are FIGHTING AS ONE. All focused on SURROUNDING NANTZ. THEN THE LASER DIES. Imlay notices the laser beam is gone.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Did we get a lock!?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: I don't know! Then... An ear-splitting NOISE. The marines look up, see.

dialogues.speaker: A CRUISE MISSILE COMING STRAIGHT DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Nantz looks up at his men, yelling:

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: INCOMING! Fall back! This way! Nantz and his men begin BACKING AWAY. Firing as they do, trying to hold off the aliens. Nantz, limping on his injured ankle, GOES DOWN. Correggio there to help him up.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Think you just twisted your ankle,. sir. And through it all, Nantz still smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Don't stop!! We're too close to the impact point!! The marines start running as...

dialogues.speaker: MORE CRUISE MISSILES APPEAR, RIPPING TOWARD THE GROUND...
dialogues.text: BOOOOOM! The first missile strikes! Then another...and another ...BOOOOM! BOOOOM! A piercing WHISTLE sounds. Nantz looks into the sky as... Suddenly KABOOOM!!! A 2000 pound laser-guided ARTILLERY SHELL explodes INTO THE GROUND... THE GROUND HEAVES UP. A MASSIVE EXPLOSION of fire and smo erupting from beneath the surface. A SHOCK WAVE BURSTS OUT FROM THE IMPACT POINT. THE MARINES ARE ENVELOPED... DISAPPEARING as... Buildings shatter, cars are tossed, flames erupt. Then SILENCE descends a moment. Only the crackle of flame falling glass. The dust and ash settles in a grey haze. Nothing could have survived this. BEAT. Then... A FIGURE RISES UP out of the grey destruction.

dialogues.speaker: MARINES
dialogues.text: AS ONE, the men rise out of the ash, standing tall.

dialogues.speaker: ON ME
dialogues.text: The marines fall in. A PHALANX with Nantz at its center.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: They move forward. Precise. Deadly. FIGHTING AS ONE. The seven remaining marines POUR FIRE on the mass of alie The Drone Ships fall from the sky, EXPLODING on the groun The aliens, in disarray, are mowed down. The rest FLEE. And as the smoke drifts away, there is silence again. Nantz looks up to see...
HIS MEN. His warriors. Standing with smoking weapons, rea for more. Correggio staggers up, covered in dust, bloody.

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: You know what, Sergeant? My brother said you were a bad ass. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: Your brother was one helluva marine, Correggio. (SMILES BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nantz sits in the rumbling chopper. Surrounded by his marines. Imlay stares out at the city below.

dialogues.speaker: PVT. IMLAY
dialogues.text: Man, it's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're in full retreat throughout Los Angeles, heading back into the ocean. Units are mopping up. On this, Nantz turns to his SQUAD. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: This has been a hell of a battle. Plenty of other battles to go. Everybody good with that? The marines don't hesitate. MARINES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: CPL. CORREGGIO
dialogues.text: Well, uh, actually, Sergeant... there's this girl I was supposed to meet up with tonight...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. NANTZ
dialogues.text: (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she'll understand. Nantz looks at his marines.
NANTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you men earned the right to call yourselves marines today. I'm damn proud of every one of you. Retreat!? MARINES

dialogues.speaker: HELL
dialogues.text: ALL
THE END
